      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Economy">Economy</span></h2> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Albania" title="Economy of Albania">Economy of Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/35/Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg/220px-Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/35/Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg/330px-Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/35/Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg/440px-Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5871" data-file-height="3914"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> is the economic hub of the country. It is home to major domestic and foreign companies operating in the country.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The transition from a socialist <a href="/wiki/Planned_economy" title="Planned economy">planned economy</a> to a capitalist <a href="/wiki/Mixed_economy" title="Mixed economy">mixed economy</a> in Albania has been largely successful.<sup id="cite_ref-worlddiplomacy_190-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-worlddiplomacy-190">[187]</a></sup> The country has a <a href="/wiki/Developing_country" title="Developing country">developing</a> mixed economy classified by the <a href="/wiki/World_Bank" title="World Bank">World Bank</a> as an <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GNI_(nominal,_Atlas_method)_per_capita#Upper-middle-income_group" class="mw-redirect" title="List of countries by GNI (nominal, Atlas method) per capita">upper-middle income economy</a>. In 2016, it had the 4th lowest <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_unemployment_rate" title="List of countries by unemployment rate">unemployment rate</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Balkans" title="Balkans">Balkans</a> with an estimated value of 14.7%. Its largest trading partners are Italy, Greece, China, Spain, Kosovo and the United States. The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_lek" title="Albanian lek">lek</a> (ALL) is the country's currency and is <a href="/wiki/Fixed_exchange_rate" class="mw-redirect" title="Fixed exchange rate">pegged</a> at approximately 132,51 lek per euro. </p>
      <p>The cities of <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a> constitute the economic and financial heart of Albania due to their high population, modern infrastructure and strategic geographical location. The country's most important infrastructure facilities take course through both of the cities, connecting the north to the south as well as the west to the east. Among the largest <a href="/wiki/List_of_companies_of_Albania" title="List of companies of Albania">companies</a> are the petroleum <a href="/wiki/Ta%C3%A7i_Oil" title="Taçi Oil">Taçi Oil</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albpetrol" title="Albpetrol">Albpetrol</a>, <a href="/wiki/ARMO_oil_refiner" title="ARMO oil refiner">ARMO</a> and Kastrati, the mineral <a href="/wiki/AlbChrome" title="AlbChrome">AlbChrome</a>, the cement <a href="/wiki/Antea_Cement" title="Antea Cement">Antea</a>, the investment <a href="/wiki/Samir_Mane" title="Samir Mane">BALFIN Group</a> and the technology <a href="/wiki/Albtelecom" title="Albtelecom">Albtelecom</a>, <a href="/wiki/Vodafone_Albania" title="Vodafone Albania">Vodafone</a>, <a href="/wiki/Telekom_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Telekom Albania">Telekom Albania</a> and others. </p>
      <p>In 2012, Albania's <a href="/wiki/GDP_per_capita" class="mw-redirect" title="GDP per capita">GDP per capita</a> stood at 30% of the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a> average, while <a href="/wiki/GDP_(PPP)_per_capita" class="mw-redirect" title="GDP (PPP) per capita">GDP (PPP) per capita</a> was 35%.<sup id="cite_ref-191" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-191">[188]</a></sup> Albania were one of three countries in Europe to record an economic growth in the first quarter of 2010 after the <a href="/wiki/Global_financial_crisis" class="mw-redirect" title="Global financial crisis">global financial crisis</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-192" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-192">[189]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-193" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-193">[190]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund" title="International Monetary Fund">International Monetary Fund</a> predicted 2.6% growth for Albania in 2010 and 3.2% in 2011.<sup id="cite_ref-194" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-194">[191]</a></sup> According to the <a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a> as of December&nbsp;2016<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Albania&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>, the <a href="/wiki/Gross_Domestic_Product_(GDP)" class="mw-redirect" title="Gross Domestic Product (GDP)">Gross Domestic Product (GDP)</a> was growing at 2.8%. The country had a <a href="/wiki/Trade_balance" class="mw-redirect" title="Trade balance">trade balance</a> of −9.7% and <a href="/wiki/Unemployment_rate" class="mw-redirect" title="Unemployment rate">unemployment rate</a> of 14.7%.<sup id="cite_ref-195" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-195">[192]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Foreign_direct_investment" title="Foreign direct investment">Foreign direct investment</a> has increased significantly in recent years as the government has embarked on an ambitious program to improve the business climate through fiscal and legislative reforms. The economy is expected to expand in the near term, driven by a recovery in consumption and robust investments. Growth is projected to be 3.2% in 2016, 3.5% in 2017, and 3.8% in 2018. </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Primary_sector">Primary sector</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Agriculture_in_Albania" title="Agriculture in Albania">Agriculture in Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg/220px-Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg/330px-Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg/440px-Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1600" data-file-height="1200"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>Grapes in <a href="/wiki/Berat" title="Berat">Berat</a>. Due to the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_climate" title="Mediterranean climate">mediterranean climate</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albanian_wine" title="Albanian wine">wine</a>, <a href="/wiki/Olive" title="Olive">olives</a> and <a href="/wiki/Citrus_fruit" class="mw-redirect" title="Citrus fruit">citrus fruits</a> are mostly produced in Southern Albania.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Agriculture in the country is based on small to medium-sized family-owned dispersed units. It remains a significant sector of the <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Albania" title="Economy of Albania">economy of Albania</a>. It employs 41%<sup id="cite_ref-196" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-196">[193]</a></sup> of the population, and about 24.31% of the land is used for agricultural purposes. One of the earliest farming sites in Europe has been found in the southeast of the country.<sup id="cite_ref-197" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-197">[194]</a></sup> As part of the pre-accession process of Albania to the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a>, farmers are being aided through <a href="/wiki/Instrument_for_Pre-Accession_Assistance" title="Instrument for Pre-Accession Assistance">IPA</a> funds to improve Albanian agriculture standards.<sup id="cite_ref-198" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-198">[195]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Albania produces significant amounts of fruits (apples, <a href="/wiki/Olive" title="Olive">olives</a>, grapes, oranges, lemons, <a href="/wiki/Apricot" title="Apricot">apricots</a>, <a href="/wiki/Peach" title="Peach">peaches</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cherry" title="Cherry">cherries</a>, <a href="/wiki/Figs" class="mw-redirect" title="Figs">figs</a>, <a href="/wiki/Prunus_cerasus" title="Prunus cerasus">sour cherries</a>, <a href="/wiki/Plum" title="Plum">plums</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Strawberry" title="Strawberry">strawberries</a>), <a href="/wiki/Vegetable_oil" title="Vegetable oil">vegetables</a> (potatoes, tomatoes, maize, onions, and wheat), <a href="/wiki/Sugar_beet" title="Sugar beet">sugar beets</a>, tobacco, meat, <a href="/wiki/Honey" title="Honey">honey</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dairy_product" title="Dairy product">dairy products</a>, traditional medicine and <a href="/wiki/Essential_oil" title="Essential oil">aromatic plants</a>. Further, the country is a worldwide significant producer of <a href="/wiki/Salvia" title="Salvia">salvia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rosemary" title="Rosemary">rosemary</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gentiana_lutea" title="Gentiana lutea">yellow gentian</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-199" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-199">[196]</a></sup> The country's proximity to the <a href="/wiki/Ionian_Sea" title="Ionian Sea">Ionian Sea</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a> give the underdeveloped fishing industry great potential. The <a href="/wiki/World_Bank" title="World Bank">World Bank</a> and <a href="/wiki/European_Community" class="mw-redirect" title="European Community">European Community</a> economists report that, Albania's fishing industry has good potential to generate export earnings because prices in the nearby Greek and Italian markets are many times higher than those in the Albanian market. The fish available off the coasts of the country are <a href="/wiki/Carp" title="Carp">carp</a>, <a href="/wiki/Trout" title="Trout">trout</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sea_bream" class="mw-redirect" title="Sea bream">sea bream</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mussel" title="Mussel">mussels</a> and <a href="/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">crustaceans</a>. </p>
      <p>Albania has one of Europe's longest histories of <a href="/wiki/Viticulture" title="Viticulture">viticulture</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-winealbania1_200-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-winealbania1-200">[197]</a></sup> The today's region was one of the few places where vine was naturally grown during the ice age. The oldest found seeds in the region are 4,000 to 6,000 years old.<sup id="cite_ref-Stevenson2011_201-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Stevenson2011-201">[198]</a></sup> In 2009, the nation produced an estimated 17,500 tonnes of wine.<sup id="cite_ref-202" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-202">[199]</a></sup> During the communist era, the production area expanded to some 20,000 hectares (49,000 acres).<sup id="cite_ref-203" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-203">[200]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Secondary_sector">Secondary sector</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       See also: <a href="/wiki/Category:Mines_in_Albania" title="Category:Mines in Albania">Category:Mines in Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB,_Albania_(10759257413).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg/220px-Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg/330px-Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg/440px-Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5616" data-file-height="3744"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Something_in_Albania_(10759257413).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The <a href="/wiki/Antea_Cement" title="Antea Cement">Antea</a> factory in <a href="/wiki/Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB" title="Fushë-Krujë">Fushë-Krujë</a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The secondary sector of Albania have undergone many changes and diversification, since the collapse of the communist regime in the country. It is very diversified, from <a href="/wiki/Electronics_industry" title="Electronics industry">electronics</a>, <a href="/wiki/Manufacturing_industries" class="mw-redirect" title="Manufacturing industries">manufacturing</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-204" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-204">[201]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Textile_industry" title="Textile industry">textiles</a>, to <a href="/wiki/Food_industry" title="Food industry">food</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cement_industry" class="mw-redirect" title="Cement industry">cement</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mining_industry" class="mw-redirect" title="Mining industry">mining</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-205" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-205">[202]</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Energy_industry" title="Energy industry">energy</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Antea_Cement" title="Antea Cement">Antea Cement</a> plant in <a href="/wiki/Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB" title="Fushë-Krujë">Fushë-Krujë</a> is considered as one of the largest industrial greenfield investments in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-206" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-206">[203]</a></sup> Albanian oil and gas is represents of the most promising albeit strictly regulated sectors of its economy. Albania has the <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_proven_oil_reserves" title="List of countries by proven oil reserves">second largest oil deposits</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Balkan_peninsula" class="mw-redirect" title="Balkan peninsula">Balkan peninsula</a> after <a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a>, and the largest <a href="/wiki/Patos-Marinza_Oil_Field" title="Patos-Marinza Oil Field">oil reserves</a><sup id="cite_ref-207" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-207">[204]</a></sup> in Europe. The <a href="/wiki/Albpetrol" title="Albpetrol">Albpetrol</a> company is owned by the Albanian state and monitors the state petroleum agreements in the country. The textile industry has seen an extensive expansion by approaching companies from the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a> (EU) in Albania. According to the <a href="/wiki/Institute_of_Statistics_(Albania)" title="Institute of Statistics (Albania)">Institute of Statistics (INSTAT)</a> as of 2016<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Albania&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>, the textile production marked an annual growth of 5.3% and an annual turnover of around 1.5&nbsp;billion euros.<sup id="cite_ref-208" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-208">[205]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Albania is a significant minerals producer and is ranked among the world's leading <a href="/wiki/Chromium" title="Chromium">chromium</a> producers and exporters.<sup id="cite_ref-209" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-209">[206]</a></sup> The nation is also a notable producer of copper, <a href="/wiki/Nickel" title="Nickel">nickel</a> and coal.<sup id="cite_ref-210" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-210">[207]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Batra_mine" title="Batra mine">Batra mine</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bulqiz%C3%AB_mine" title="Bulqizë mine">Bulqizë mine</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Thekna_mine" title="Thekna mine">Thekna mine</a> are among the most recognised Albanian mines that are still in operation. </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Tertiary_sector">Tertiary sector</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       See also: <a href="/wiki/Banking_in_Albania" title="Banking in Albania">Banking</a>, <a href="/wiki/Telecommunications_in_Albania" title="Telecommunications in Albania">Telecommunications</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Tourism_in_Albania" title="Tourism in Albania">Tourism in Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg/220px-Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg/330px-Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg/440px-Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="686"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The <a href="/wiki/Islets_of_Ksamil" title="Islets of Ksamil">Islets of Ksamil</a> in the south of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Ionian_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Ionian Sea Coast">Albanian Ionian Sea Coast</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Tertiary_sector" class="mw-redirect" title="Tertiary sector">tertiary sector</a> represents the fastest growing sector of the country's economy. 36% of the population work in the service sector which contributes to 65% of the country's GDP.<sup id="cite_ref-DSSA_211-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DSSA-211">[208]</a></sup> Ever since the end of the 20th century, the <a href="/wiki/Banking_industry" class="mw-redirect" title="Banking industry">banking industry</a> is a major component of the tertiary sector and remains in good conditions overall due to <a href="/wiki/Privatization" title="Privatization">privatization</a> and the commendable <a href="/wiki/Monetary_policy" title="Monetary policy">monetary policy</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-212" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-212">[209]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-DSSA_211-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DSSA-211">[208]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Previously one of the most <a href="/wiki/Isolationism" title="Isolationism">isolated</a> and controlled countries in the world, <a href="/wiki/Telecommunication_industry" class="mw-redirect" title="Telecommunication industry">telecommunication industry</a> represents nowadays another major contributor to the sector. It developed largely through privatisation and subsequent investment by both domestic and foreign investors.<sup id="cite_ref-DSSA_211-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DSSA-211">[208]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Eagle_Mobile" class="mw-redirect" title="Eagle Mobile">Eagle</a>, <a href="/wiki/Vodafone_Albania" title="Vodafone Albania">Vodafone</a> and <a href="/wiki/Telekom_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Telekom Albania">Telekom Albania</a> are the leading <a href="/wiki/Telecommunications_service_provider" title="Telecommunications service provider">telecommunications service providers</a> in the country. </p>
      <p>Tourism is recognised as an industry of national importance and has been steadily increasing since the beginnings of the 21st century.<sup id="cite_ref-213" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-213">[210]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-214" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-214">[211]</a></sup> It directly accounted for 8.4% of GDP in 2016 though including indirect contributions pushes the proportion to 26%.<sup id="cite_ref-215" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-215">[212]</a></sup> In the same year, the country received approximately 4.74&nbsp;million visitors mostly from across Europe and the United States as well.<sup id="cite_ref-216" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-216">[213]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The increase of foreign visitors has been dramatic. Albania had only 500,000 visitors in 2005, while in 2012 had an estimated 4.2&nbsp;million, an increase of 740 percent in only 7 years. In 2015, tourism in summer increased by 25 percent in contrast the previous year according to the country's tourism agency.<sup id="cite_ref-217" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-217">[214]</a></sup> In 2011, <a href="/wiki/Lonely_Planet" title="Lonely Planet">Lonely Planet</a> named as a top travel destination,<sup id="cite_ref-Lonely_Planet's_top_10_218-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lonely_Planet's_top_10-218">[215]</a></sup><sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability" title="Wikipedia:Verifiability"><span title="How could a 2011 article talk about 2015? anyway link needs updating (November 2017)">failed verification</span></a></i>]</sup> while <a href="/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a> placed Albania as number 4 global touristic destination in 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-219" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-219">[216]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The bulk of the tourist industry is concentrated along the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic" class="mw-redirect" title="Adriatic">Adriatic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ionian_Sea" title="Ionian Sea">Ionian Sea</a> in the west of the country. However, the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Riviera" title="Albanian Riviera">Albanian Riviera</a> in the southwest has the most scenic and pristine beaches, and is often called the pearl of the Albanian coast. Its coastline has a considerable length of 446 kilometres (277 miles).<sup id="cite_ref-220" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-220">[217]</a></sup> The coast has a particular character because it is rich in varieties of virgin beaches, capes, coves, covered bays, lagoons, small gravel beaches, sea caves and many landforms. Some parts of this seaside are very clean ecologically, which represent in this prospective unexplored areas, which are very rare within the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean" class="mw-redirect" title="Mediterranean">Mediterranean</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-221" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-221">[218]</a></sup> Other attractions include the mountainous areas such as the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ceraunian_Mountains" title="Ceraunian Mountains">Ceraunian Mountains</a> and <a href="/wiki/Korab" title="Korab">Korab</a> Mountains but also the historical cities of <a href="/wiki/Berat" title="Berat">Berat</a>, <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gjirokast%C3%ABr" title="Gjirokastër">Gjirokastër</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sarand%C3%AB" title="Sarandë">Sarandë</a>, <a href="/wiki/Shkod%C3%ABr" title="Shkodër">Shkodër</a> and <a href="/wiki/Kor%C3%A7%C3%AB" title="Korçë">Korçë</a>. </p> 
      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Transport">Transport</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Transport_in_Albania" title="Transport in Albania">Transport in Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Autostrada_Durr%C3%ABs-Morina-05.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Autostrada_Durr%C3%ABs-Morina-05.jpg/220px-Autostrada_Durr%C3%ABs-Morina-05.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Autostrada_Durr%C3%ABs-Morina-05.jpg/330px-Autostrada_Durr%C3%ABs-Morina-05.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Autostrada_Durr%C3%ABs-Morina-05.jpg/440px-Autostrada_Durr%C3%ABs-Morina-05.jpg 2x" data-file-width="720" data-file-height="540"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Autostrada_Durr%C3%ABs-Morina-05.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs-Kuk%C3%ABs_Highway" title="Durrës-Kukës Highway">Rruga e Kombit</a> connects the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a> across the <a href="/wiki/Western_Lowlands" title="Western Lowlands">Western Lowlands</a> with the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a> in the north reaching the border with <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Transportation in Albania is managed within the functions of the <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Infrastructure_and_Energy_(Albania)" title="Ministry of Infrastructure and Energy (Albania)">Ministry of Infrastructure and Energy</a> and entities such as the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Road_Authority" title="Albanian Road Authority">Albanian Road Authority</a> (ARRSH), responsible for the construction and maintenance of the <a href="/wiki/Highways_in_Albania" title="Highways in Albania">highways</a> and <a href="/wiki/Motorways_in_Albania" title="Motorways in Albania">motorways</a> in Albania, as well as the <a href="/wiki/Civil_Aviation_Authority_(Albania)" title="Civil Aviation Authority (Albania)">Albanian Aviation Authority</a> (AAC), with the responsibility of coordinating civil aviation and airports in the country. </p>
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Tirana_International_Airport_N%C3%ABn%C3%AB_Tereza" title="Tirana International Airport Nënë Tereza">international airport</a> of <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> is the premier air gateway to the country, and is also the principal hub for Albania's national <a href="/wiki/Flag_carrier" title="Flag carrier">flag carrier</a> airline, <a href="/wiki/Air_Albania" title="Air Albania">Air Albania</a>. The airport carried more than 3.3 million passengers in 2019 with connections to many destinations in other countries around <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a>, <a href="/wiki/Africa" title="Africa">Africa</a> and <a href="/wiki/Asia" title="Asia">Asia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-222" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-222">[219]</a></sup> The country plans to progressively increase the number of airports especially in the south with possible locations in <a href="/wiki/Sarand%C3%AB" title="Sarandë">Sarandë</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gjirokast%C3%ABr" title="Gjirokastër">Gjirokastër</a> and <a href="/wiki/Vlor%C3%AB_International_Airport" title="Vlorë International Airport">Vlorë</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-223" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-223">[220]</a></sup> </p> 
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Terminal_jashte.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Terminal_jashte.jpg/220px-Terminal_jashte.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Terminal_jashte.jpg/330px-Terminal_jashte.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Terminal_jashte.jpg/440px-Terminal_jashte.jpg 2x" data-file-width="583" data-file-height="389"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Terminal_jashte.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Tirana_International_Airport" class="mw-redirect" title="Tirana International Airport">Tirana International Airport</a> is named in honour of the Albanian nun and missionary <a href="/wiki/Mother_Teresa" title="Mother Teresa">Mother Teresa</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Highways_in_Albania" title="Highways in Albania">highways</a> and <a href="/wiki/Motorways_in_Albania" title="Motorways in Albania">motorways in Albania</a> are properly maintained and often still under construction and renovation. The <a href="/wiki/A1_motorway_(Albania)" class="mw-redirect" title="A1 motorway (Albania)">Autostrada 1</a> (A1) represents an integral transportation corridor in Albania and the longest motorway of the country. It will prospectively link <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a> on the Adriatic Sea across <a href="/wiki/Pristina" title="Pristina">Pristina</a> in Kosovo with the <a href="/wiki/Pan-European_Corridor_X" title="Pan-European Corridor X">Pan-European Corridor X</a> in Serbia.<sup id="cite_ref-SEETO_224-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SEETO-224">[221]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-225" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-225">[222]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/A2_motorway_(Albania)" class="mw-redirect" title="A2 motorway (Albania)">Autostrada 2</a> (A2) is part of the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic%E2%80%93Ionian_motorway" title="Adriatic–Ionian motorway">Adriatic–Ionian Corridor</a> as well as the <a href="/wiki/Pan-European_Corridor_VIII" title="Pan-European Corridor VIII">Pan-European Corridor VIII</a> and connects <a href="/wiki/Fier" title="Fier">Fier</a> with <a href="/wiki/Vlor%C3%AB" title="Vlorë">Vlorë</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-SEETO_224-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SEETO-224">[221]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/A3_motorway_(Albania)" class="mw-redirect" title="A3 motorway (Albania)">Autostrada 3</a> (A3) is currently under construction and will connect, after its completion, <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> and <a href="/wiki/Elbasan" title="Elbasan">Elbasan</a> with the Pan-European Corridor VIII. When all three corridors are completed, Albania will have an estimated 759 kilometres (472&nbsp;mi) of highway linking it with all of its neighboring countries. </p> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg/220px-Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="78" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg/330px-Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg/440px-Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2048" data-file-height="729"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The highly advantageous location of <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a> makes <a href="/wiki/Port_of_Durr%C3%ABs" title="Port of Durrës">its port</a> the busiest in Albania and among the largest in the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p><a href="/wiki/Port_of_Durr%C3%ABs" title="Port of Durrës">Durrës</a> is the busiest and largest <a href="/wiki/Seaport" class="mw-redirect" title="Seaport">seaport</a> in the country, followed by <a href="/wiki/Port_of_Vlor%C3%AB" title="Port of Vlorë">Vlorë</a>, <a href="/wiki/Port_of_Sh%C3%ABngjin" title="Port of Shëngjin">Shëngjin</a> and <a href="/wiki/Port_of_Sarand%C3%AB" title="Port of Sarandë">Sarandë</a>. As of 2014<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Albania&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>, it is as one of the largest passenger ports on the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a> with annual passenger volume of approximately 1.5&nbsp;million. The principal ports serve a system of ferries connecting Albania with numerous islands and coastal cities in Croatia, Greece and Italy. </p>
      <p>The rail network is administered by the national railway company <a href="/wiki/Hekurudha_Shqiptare" title="Hekurudha Shqiptare">Hekurudha Shqiptare</a> which was extensively promoted by the dictator <a href="/wiki/Enver_Hoxha" title="Enver Hoxha">Enver Hoxha</a>. There has been a considerable increase in private car ownership and bus usage while rail use decreased since the end of communism. However, a new railway line from Tirana and its airport to Durrës is currently planned. The specific location of this railway, connecting the most populated urban areas in Albania, merely makes it an important economic development project.<sup id="cite_ref-226" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-226">[223]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-227" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-227">[224]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Infrastructure">Infrastructure</span></h2> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Education">Education</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Education_in_Albania" title="Education in Albania">Education in Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg/220px-Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg/330px-Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg/440px-Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2227" data-file-height="1479"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The <a href="/wiki/University_of_Arts_(Albania)" class="mw-redirect" title="University of Arts (Albania)">University of Arts</a> is the largest higher education institute dedicated to the study of arts.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>In the country, education is secular, free, <a href="/wiki/Compulsory_education" title="Compulsory education">compulsory</a> and based on three levels of education segmented in primary, secondary and tertiary education.<sup id="cite_ref-Official_228-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Official-228">[225]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Epnuffic_229-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Epnuffic-229">[226]</a></sup> The academic year is apportioned into two semesters beginning in September or October, and ending in June or July. <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a> serves as the <a href="/wiki/Primary_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Primary language">primary language</a> of instruction in all <a href="/wiki/State_school" title="State school">academic institutions</a> across the country.<sup id="cite_ref-Epnuffic_229-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Epnuffic-229">[226]</a></sup> The study of a first <a href="/wiki/Foreign_language" title="Foreign language">foreign language</a> is mandatory and taught most often at elementary and bilingual schools.<sup id="cite_ref-foreign_languages_230-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-foreign_languages-230">[227]</a></sup> The languages taught in schools are English, Italian, French and German.<sup id="cite_ref-foreign_languages_230-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-foreign_languages-230">[227]</a></sup> The country has a <a href="/wiki/School_life_expectancy" title="School life expectancy">school life expectancy</a> of 16 years and a <a href="/wiki/Literacy_rate" class="mw-redirect" title="Literacy rate">literacy rate</a> of 98.7%, with 99.2% for males and 98.3% for females.<sup id="cite_ref-231" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-231">[228]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-cia_10-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cia-10">[7]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Compulsory primary education is divided into two levels, elementary and secondary school, from grade one to five and six to nine, respectively.<sup id="cite_ref-Official_228-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Official-228">[225]</a></sup> Pupils are required to attend school from the age of six until they turn 16. Upon successful completion of primary education, all pupils are entitled to attend high schools with specialising in any particular field including arts, <a href="/wiki/Sport" title="Sport">sports</a>, <a href="/wiki/Language" title="Language">languages</a>, sciences or technology.<sup id="cite_ref-Official_228-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Official-228">[225]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The country's tertiary education, an optional stage of formal learning following secondary education, has undergone a thorough reformation and restructuring in compliance with the principles of the <a href="/wiki/Bologna_Process" title="Bologna Process">Bologna Process</a>. There is a significant number of private and public <a href="/wiki/Institutions_of_higher_education" class="mw-redirect" title="Institutions of higher education">institutions of higher education</a> well dispersed in the major cities of Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-232" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-232">[229]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Epnuffic_229-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Epnuffic-229">[226]</a></sup> Studies in tertiary education are organized at three successive levels which include the <a href="/wiki/Bachelor%27s_degree" title="Bachelor's degree">bachelor</a>, <a href="/wiki/Master%27s_degree" title="Master's degree">master</a> and <a href="/wiki/Doctorate_Degree" class="mw-redirect" title="Doctorate Degree">doctorate</a>. </p> 
      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Health">Health</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Health_in_Albania" title="Health in Albania">Health in Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg/220px-Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg/330px-Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg/440px-Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1920" data-file-height="1271"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_cuisine" title="Albanian cuisine">Albanian cuisine</a> from the Mediterranean, which is characterised by the use of fruits, vegetables and <a href="/wiki/Olive_oil" title="Olive oil">olive oil</a>, contributes to the good nutrition of the country's population.<sup id="cite_ref-233" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-233">[230]</a></sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Albania" title="Constitution of Albania">constitution of Albania</a> guarantees equal, free and <a href="/wiki/Universal_health_care" title="Universal health care">universal health care</a> for all its citizens.<sup id="cite_ref-234" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-234">[231]</a></sup> The health care system of the country is currently organised in three levels, among others <a href="/wiki/Primary_healthcare" class="mw-redirect" title="Primary healthcare">primary</a>, <a href="/wiki/Secondary_care" class="mw-redirect" title="Secondary care">secondary</a> and <a href="/wiki/Tertiary_healthcare" class="mw-redirect" title="Tertiary healthcare">tertiary healthcare</a>, and is in a process of modernisation and development.<sup id="cite_ref-cod_235-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cod-235">[232]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-hospitals_236-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-hospitals-236">[233]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Life_expectancy" title="Life expectancy">life expectancy</a> at birth in Albania is at 77.8 years and ranks <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_life_expectancy" title="List of countries by life expectancy">37th</a> in the world outperforming several <a href="/wiki/Developed_countries" class="mw-redirect" title="Developed countries">developed countries</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-237" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-237">[234]</a></sup> The average <a href="/wiki/Life_expectancy#Healthy_life_expectancy" title="Life expectancy">healthy life expectancy</a> is at 68.8 years and ranks as well 37th in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-238" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-238">[235]</a></sup> The country's <a href="/wiki/Infant_mortality_rate" class="mw-redirect" title="Infant mortality rate">infant mortality rate</a> is estimated at 12 per 1,000 live births in 2015. In 2000, the country had the 55th best healthcare performance in the world, as defined by the <a href="/wiki/World_Health_Organization" title="World Health Organization">World Health Organization</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-239" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-239">[236]</a></sup> </p>
      <p><a href="/wiki/Cardiovascular_disease" title="Cardiovascular disease">Cardiovascular disease</a> remain the principal cause of death in the country accounting 52% of total deaths.<sup id="cite_ref-cod_235-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cod-235">[232]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Accident" title="Accident">Accidents</a>, injuries, <a href="/wiki/Malignant_disease" class="mw-redirect" title="Malignant disease">malignant</a> and <a href="/wiki/Respiratory_disease" title="Respiratory disease">respiratory diseases</a> are other primary causes of death.<sup id="cite_ref-cod_235-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cod-235">[232]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Neuropsychiatric_disorders" class="mw-redirect" title="Neuropsychiatric disorders">Neuropsychiatric disease</a> has also increased due to recent demographic, social and economic changes in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-cod_235-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cod-235">[232]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>In 2009, the country had a fruit and vegetable supply of 886 grams per capita per day, the fifth highest supply in Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-240" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-240">[237]</a></sup> In comparison to other developed and developing countries, Albania has a relatively low rate of <a href="/wiki/Obesity" title="Obesity">obesity</a> probably thanks to the health benefits of the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_diet" title="Mediterranean diet">Mediterranean diet</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-241" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-241">[238]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-242" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-242">[239]</a></sup> According to <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_Body_Mass_Index_(BMI)#WHO_Data_on_Prevalence_of_Obesity_(BMI_above_30)_(2014)" class="mw-redirect" title="List of countries by Body Mass Index (BMI)">World Health Organization data from 2016</a>, 21.7% of adults in the country are clinically <a href="/wiki/Overweight" title="Overweight">overweight</a>, with a <a href="/wiki/Body_mass_index" title="Body mass index">Body mass index</a> (BMI) score of 25 or more.<sup id="cite_ref-243" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-243">[240]</a></sup> </p> 
      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Energy">Energy</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Renewable_energy_in_Albania" title="Renewable energy in Albania">Renewable energy in Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_power_stations_in_Albania" title="List of power stations in Albania">Power stations</a> and <a href="/wiki/List_of_oil_and_gas_fields_in_Albania" title="List of oil and gas fields in Albania">Oil fields in Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Albania_electricity_production.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Albania_electricity_production.svg/300px-Albania_electricity_production.svg.png" decoding="async" width="300" height="227" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Albania_electricity_production.svg/450px-Albania_electricity_production.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Albania_electricity_production.svg/600px-Albania_electricity_production.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="639" data-file-height="484"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Albania_electricity_production.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>Albania electricity production
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bb/Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg/220px-Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="62" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bb/Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg/330px-Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bb/Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg/440px-Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg 2x" data-file-width="10368" data-file-height="2936"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Lake_Koman" title="Lake Koman">Lake Koman</a> was formed as a result of the construction of the <a href="/wiki/Koman_Hydroelectric_Power_Station" title="Koman Hydroelectric Power Station">Koman Hydroelectric Power Station</a> in 1985.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Due to its geographical location and natural resources, Albania has a wide variety of <a href="/wiki/Energy_resource" class="mw-redirect" title="Energy resource">energy resources</a> ranging from gas, oil and coal, to <a href="/wiki/Wind_energy" class="mw-redirect" title="Wind energy">wind</a>, <a href="/wiki/Solar_energy" title="Solar energy">solar</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hydropower" title="Hydropower">water</a> as well as other <a href="/wiki/Renewable_energy" title="Renewable energy">renewable</a> sources.<sup id="cite_ref-244" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-244">[241]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-245" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-245">[242]</a></sup> Currently, the electricity generation sector of Albania is dependent on <a href="/wiki/Hydroelectricity" title="Hydroelectricity">hydroelectricity</a> simultaneously ranking fifth in the world in percentage terms.<sup id="cite_ref-246" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-246">[243]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-247" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-247">[244]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-248" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-248">[245]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Drin_(river)" title="Drin (river)">Drin</a>, located in the north, hosts four <a href="/wiki/Hydroelectric_power_station" class="mw-redirect" title="Hydroelectric power station">hydroelectric power stations</a>, including <a href="/wiki/Fierza_Hydroelectric_Power_Station" title="Fierza Hydroelectric Power Station">Fierza</a>, <a href="/wiki/Koman_Hydroelectric_Power_Station" title="Koman Hydroelectric Power Station">Koman</a>, <a href="/wiki/Skavica_Hydro_Power_Plant" title="Skavica Hydro Power Plant">Skavica</a> and <a href="/wiki/Vau_i_Dej%C3%ABs_Hydroelectric_Power_Station" title="Vau i Dejës Hydroelectric Power Station">Vau i Dejës</a>. Two other power stations, such as the <a href="/wiki/Banj%C3%AB_Hydro_Power_Plant" title="Banjë Hydro Power Plant">Banjë</a> and <a href="/wiki/Moglic%C3%AB_Hydro_Power_Plant" title="Moglicë Hydro Power Plant">Moglicë</a>, are located along the <a href="/wiki/Devoll_(river)" title="Devoll (river)">Devoll</a> in the south.<sup id="cite_ref-249" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-249">[246]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Albania has considerably large deposits of oil. It has the 10th largest oil reserves in Europe and the 58th in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-250" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-250">[247]</a></sup> The country's main petroleum deposits are located around the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Adriatic_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast">Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast</a> and <a href="/wiki/Myzeqe" title="Myzeqe">Myzeqe</a> Plain within the <a href="/wiki/Western_Lowlands" title="Western Lowlands">Western Lowlands</a>, where the country's largest reserve is located. Although, <a href="/wiki/Patos-Marinza_Oil_Field" title="Patos-Marinza Oil Field">Patos-Marinza</a>, also located within the area, is the largest onshore <a href="/wiki/Oil_field" class="mw-redirect" title="Oil field">oil field</a> in Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-251" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-251">[248]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>After the completion of the <a href="/wiki/Trans_Adriatic_Pipeline" title="Trans Adriatic Pipeline">Trans Adriatic Pipeline</a> (TAP), Albania will be significantly connected to the planned <a href="/wiki/Southern_Gas_Corridor" title="Southern Gas Corridor">Southern Gas Corridor</a>, that will transport <a href="/wiki/Natural_gas" title="Natural gas">natural gas</a> from the <a href="/wiki/Caspian_Sea" title="Caspian Sea">Caspian Sea</a> through Albania to Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-252" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-252">[249]</a></sup> Withal the TAP runs for 215 kilometres (134 miles) across Albania's territory before entering the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Adriatic_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast">Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast</a> approximately 17 kilometres (11 miles) northwest of <a href="/wiki/Fier" title="Fier">Fier</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-253" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-253">[250]</a></sup> In 2009, the company <a href="/wiki/Enel" title="Enel">Enel</a> announced plans to build an 800 MW <a href="/wiki/Coal_Fired_Power_Plant" class="mw-redirect" title="Coal Fired Power Plant">coal-fired power plant</a> in the country, to diversify electricity sources.<sup id="cite_ref-diversify_254-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-diversify-254">[251]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Water_resources" title="Water resources">water resources</a> of Albania are particularly abundant in all the regions of the country and comprise <a href="/wiki/Lakes_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Lakes of Albania">lakes</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rivers_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Rivers of Albania">rivers</a>, springs and groundwater aquifers.<sup id="cite_ref-255" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-255">[252]</a></sup> The country's available average quantity of <a href="/wiki/Fresh_water" title="Fresh water">fresh water</a> is estimated at 1,297 cubic metres (45,803 cubic feet) per inhabitant per year, which is one of the highest rates in Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-256" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-256">[253]</a></sup> According to the data presented by the <a href="/wiki/Joint_Monitoring_Programme_for_Water_Supply_and_Sanitation" title="Joint Monitoring Programme for Water Supply and Sanitation">Joint Monitoring Program for Water Supply and Sanitation</a> (JMP) in 2015, about 93% of the country's total population had access to <a href="/wiki/Improved_sanitation" title="Improved sanitation">improved sanitation</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-257" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-257">[254]</a></sup> </p> 
      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Technology">Technology</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Science_and_technology_in_Albania" title="Science and technology in Albania">Technology</a> and <a href="/wiki/Telecommunications_in_Albania" title="Telecommunications in Albania">Telecommunications in Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <p>After the <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">fall of communism</a> in 1991, human resources in sciences and technology in Albania have drastically decreased. As of various reports, during 1991 to 2005 approximately 50% of the professors and scientists of the universities and science institutions in the country have left Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-dfid_258-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-dfid-258">[255]</a></sup> In 2009, the <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Government of Albania">government</a> approved the National Strategy for Science, Technology and Innovation in Albania covering the period 2009 to 2015.<sup id="cite_ref-259" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-259">[256]</a></sup> It aims to triple public spending on <a href="/wiki/Research_and_development" title="Research and development">research and development</a> to 0.6% of GDP and augment the share of <a href="/wiki/Gross_domestic_expenditure_on_R%26D" class="mw-redirect" title="Gross domestic expenditure on R&amp;D">GDE</a> from foreign sources, including the framework programmes for research of the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a>, to the point where it covers 40% of research spending, among others. </p>
      <p>Telecommunication represents one of the fastest growing and dynamic sectors in Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-National_Plan_260-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-National_Plan-260">[257]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-261" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-261">[258]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Vodafone_Albania" title="Vodafone Albania">Vodafone Albania</a>, <a href="/wiki/Telekom_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Telekom Albania">Telekom Albania</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albtelecom" title="Albtelecom">Albtelecom</a> are the three large providers of <a href="/wiki/Mobile_network_operator" title="Mobile network operator">mobile</a> and <a href="/wiki/Internet" title="Internet">internet</a> in Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-National_Plan_260-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-National_Plan-260">[257]</a></sup> As of the <a href="/wiki/Electronic_and_Postal_Communications_Authority_(Albania)" title="Electronic and Postal Communications Authority (Albania)">Electronic and Postal Communications Authority</a> (AKEP) in 2018, the country had approximately 2.7 million active mobile users with almost 1.8 million active broadband subscribers.<sup id="cite_ref-AKEP_262-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AKEP-262">[259]</a></sup> Vodafone Albania alone served more than 931,000 mobile users, Telekom Albania had about 605,000 users and Albtelecom had more than 272,000 users.<sup id="cite_ref-AKEP_262-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AKEP-262">[259]</a></sup> </p> 
      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Demography">Demography</span></h2> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Albania" title="Demographics of Albania">Demography of Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       See also: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian people">Albanian people</a> and <a href="/wiki/Origin_of_the_Albanians" title="Origin of the Albanians">Origin of the Albanians</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Albania_demography.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Albania_demography.svg/220px-Albania_demography.svg.png" decoding="async" width="220" height="132" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Albania_demography.svg/330px-Albania_demography.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Albania_demography.svg/440px-Albania_demography.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="750" data-file-height="450"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Albania_demography.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>Development of the <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Albania" title="Demographics of Albania">population of Albania</a> over the last sixty years.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>As defined by the <a href="/wiki/Institute_of_Statistics_(Albania)" title="Institute of Statistics (Albania)">Institute of Statistics</a> (INSTAT), the <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Albania" title="Demographics of Albania">population</a> of Albania was estimated in 2020 at 2,845,955.<sup id="cite_ref-263" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-263">[260]</a></sup> The country's <a href="/wiki/Total_fertility_rate" title="Total fertility rate">total fertility rate</a> of 1.51 children born per woman is one of the <a href="/wiki/List_of_sovereign_states_and_dependent_territories_by_fertility_rate" class="mw-redirect" title="List of sovereign states and dependent territories by fertility rate">lowest in the world</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-CIA_demography_264-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CIA_demography-264">[261]</a></sup> Its <a href="/wiki/List_of_sovereign_states_and_dependent_territories_by_population_density" class="mw-redirect" title="List of sovereign states and dependent territories by population density">population density</a> stands at 259 inhabitants per square kilometre. The overall <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_life_expectancy" title="List of countries by life expectancy">life expectancy</a> at birth is 78.5 years; 75.8 years for males and 81.4 years for females.<sup id="cite_ref-CIA_demography_264-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CIA_demography-264">[261]</a></sup> The country is the <a href="/wiki/Balkans#Demographics" title="Balkans">8th most populous country</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Balkans" title="Balkans">Balkans</a> and ranks as the <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_population" title="List of countries and dependencies by population">137th most populous country</a> in the world. Nonetheless, the country's population rose steadily from 2,5&nbsp;million in 1979 until 1989, when it peaked at 3.1&nbsp;million.<sup id="cite_ref-265" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-265">[262]</a></sup> It is forecasted that the population will continue shrinking for the next decade at least, depending on the actual <a href="/wiki/Birth_rate" title="Birth rate">birth rate</a> and the level of <a href="/wiki/Net_migration_rate" title="Net migration rate">net migration</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-266" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-266">[263]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The explanation for the recent population decrease is the <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">fall of communism in Albania</a> in the late twentieth century. That period was marked by economic <a href="/wiki/Mass_migration" title="Mass migration">mass emigration</a> from Albania to <a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">Greece</a>, Italy and the United States. Four decades of total <a href="/wiki/Communism_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Communism in Albania">isolation</a> from the world, combined with its disastrous economic, social and political situation, had caused this exodus. The <a href="/wiki/Human_migration" title="Human migration">external migration</a> was prohibited outright during the communist era, while <a href="/wiki/Human_migration" title="Human migration">internal migration</a> was quite limited, hence this was a new phenomenon. At least, 900,000 people left Albania during this period, with about 600,000 of them settling in Greece.<sup id="cite_ref-267" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-267">[264]</a></sup> The migration affected the country's internal population distribution. It decreased particularly in the north and south, while it increased in the center within the cities of <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (March 2009)">citation needed</span></a></i>]</sup> </p>
      <p>About 53.4% of the country's <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Albania" title="Demographics of Albania">population</a> lives in cities. The three largest counties by population account for half of the total population. Almost 30% of the total population is found in <a href="/wiki/Tirana_County" title="Tirana County">Tirana County</a> followed by <a href="/wiki/Fier_County" title="Fier County">Fier County</a> with 11% and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs_County" title="Durrës County">Durrës County</a> with 10%.<sup id="cite_ref-268" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-268">[265]</a></sup> Over 1 million people are concentrated in <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>, making it the largest urban area in Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-269" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-269">[266]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> is one of largest cities in the <a href="/wiki/Balkan_Peninsula" class="mw-redirect" title="Balkan Peninsula">Balkan Peninsula</a> and ranks seventh with a population about 800,000.<sup id="cite_ref-census15_270-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-census15-270">[267]</a></sup> The second largest city in the country by population is <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>, with a population of 201,110, followed by <a href="/wiki/Vlor%C3%AB" title="Vlorë">Vlorë</a> with a population of 141,513. </p> 
      <table class="infobox" style="text-align:left; width:97%; margin-right:10px; font-size:90%">

      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Minorities">Minorities</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Minorities_of_Albania" title="Minorities of Albania">Minorities of Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <p>Issues of ethnicity are a delicate topic and subject to debate. Contrary to official statistics that show an over 97 per cent Albanian majority in the country, minority groups (such as <a href="/wiki/Greeks_in_Albania" title="Greeks in Albania">Greeks</a>, <a href="/wiki/Macedonians_in_Albania" title="Macedonians in Albania">Macedonians</a>, <a href="/wiki/Montenegrins_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Montenegrins of Albania">Montenegrins</a>, <a href="/wiki/Roma_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Roma in Albania">Roma</a> and <a href="/wiki/Aromanians_in_Albania" title="Aromanians in Albania">Aromanians</a>) have frequently disputed the official numbers, asserting a higher percentage of the country's population. According to the disputed 2011 census, ethnic affiliation was as follows: <a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a> 2,312,356 (82.6% of the total), <a href="/wiki/Greeks_in_Albania" title="Greeks in Albania">Greeks</a> 24,243 (0.9%), <a href="/wiki/Macedonians_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Macedonians of Albania">Macedonians</a> 5,512 (0.2%), <a href="/wiki/Montenegrins_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Montenegrins of Albania">Montenegrins</a> 366 (0.01%), <a href="/wiki/Aromanians" title="Aromanians">Aromanians</a> 8,266 (0.30%), <a href="/wiki/Romani_people" title="Romani people">Romani</a> 8,301 (0.3%), <a href="/wiki/Balkan_Egyptians" class="mw-redirect" title="Balkan Egyptians">Balkan Egyptians</a> 3,368 (0.1%), other ethnicities 2,644 (0.1%), no declared ethnicity 390,938 (14.0%), and not relevant 44,144 (1.6%).<sup id="cite_ref-Population_and_Housing_Census_2011_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Population_and_Housing_Census_2011-2">[2]</a></sup> On the quality of the specific data the Advisory Committee on the <a href="/wiki/Framework_Convention_for_the_Protection_of_National_Minorities" title="Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities">Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities</a> stated that "the results of the census should be viewed with the utmost caution and calls on the authorities not to rely exclusively on the data on nationality collected during the census in determining its policy on the protection of national minorities.".<sup id="cite_ref-272" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-272">[269]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Albania recognises nine national or cultural minorities: <a href="/wiki/Aromanians" title="Aromanians">Aromanian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Greeks" title="Greeks">Greek</a>, <a href="/wiki/Macedonians_(ethnic_group)" title="Macedonians (ethnic group)">Macedonian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Montenegrins" title="Montenegrins">Montenegrin</a>, <a href="/wiki/Serbs" title="Serbs">Serb</a>, <a href="/wiki/Romani_people" title="Romani people">Roma</a>, <a href="/wiki/Egyptians_(Balkans)" class="mw-redirect" title="Egyptians (Balkans)">Egyptian</a>, Bosnian and <a href="/wiki/Bulgarians" title="Bulgarians">Bulgarian</a> peoples.<sup id="cite_ref-273" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-273">[270]</a></sup> Other Albanian minorities are the <a href="/wiki/Gorani_people" title="Gorani people">Gorani people</a> and Jews.<sup id="cite_ref-274" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-274">[271]</a></sup> Regarding the Greeks, "it is difficult to know how many Greeks there are in Albania". The estimates vary between 60,000 and 300,000 ethnic Greeks in Albania. According to Ian Jeffries, most of Western sources put the number at around 200,000. The 300,000 mark is supported by Greek government as well.<sup id="cite_ref-RFE/RL_Research_Report:_Weekly_Analyses_from_the_RFE/RL_Research_Institute_275-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RFE/RL_Research_Report:_Weekly_Analyses_from_the_RFE/RL_Research_Institute-275">[272]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BideleuxJeffries2006_276-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BideleuxJeffries2006-276">[273]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ramet1998_277-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ramet1998-277">[274]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Jeffries2002_278-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jeffries2002-278">[275]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Publications2008_279-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Publications2008-279">[276]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/CIA_World_Factbook" class="mw-redirect" title="CIA World Factbook">CIA World Factbook</a> estimates the Greek minority to constitute 0.9%<sup id="cite_ref-280" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-280">[277]</a></sup> of the total population. The US State Department estimates that Greeks make up 1.17%, and other minorities 0.23%, of the population.<sup id="cite_ref-281" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-281">[278]</a></sup> The latter questions the validity of the census data about the Greek minority, due to the fact that measurements have been affected by boycott.<sup id="cite_ref-282" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-282">[279]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Macedonians and some Greek minority groups have sharply criticised Article 20 of the Census law, according to which a $1,000 fine will be imposed on anyone who will declare an ethnicity other than what is stated on his or her birth certificate. This is claimed to be an attempt to intimidate minorities into declaring Albanian ethnicity; according to them the Albanian government has stated that it will jail anyone who does not participate in the census or refuse to declare his or her ethnicity.<sup id="cite_ref-283" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-283">[280]</a></sup> Genc Pollo, the minister in charge has declared that: "Albanian citizens will be able to freely express their ethnic and religious affiliation and mother tongue. However, they are not forced to answer these sensitive questions".<sup id="cite_ref-284" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-284">[281]</a></sup> The amendments criticized do not include jailing or forced declaration of ethnicity or religion; only a fine is envisioned which can be overthrown by court.<sup id="cite_ref-285" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-285">[282]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-286" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-286">[283]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Greek representatives form part of the Albanian parliament and the government has invited Albanian Greeks to register, as the only way to improve their status.<sup id="cite_ref-EUDO_287-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-EUDO-287">[284]</a></sup> On the other hand, nationalists, various organisations and political parties in Albania have expressed their concern that the census might artificially increase the numbers of the Greek minority, which might be then exploited by Greece to threaten Albania's territorial integrity.<sup id="cite_ref-EUDO_287-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-EUDO-287">[284]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Maria_Karathanos,_Constantine_Callaghan_288-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Maria_Karathanos,_Constantine_Callaghan-288">[285]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-289" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-289">[286]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BalkanChronicle_290-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BalkanChronicle-290">[287]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-291" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-291">[288]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-292" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-292">[289]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-293" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-293">[290]</a></sup> </p> 
      <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r978413945/mw-parser-output/.tmulti">.mw-parser-output .tmulti .thumbinner{display:flex;flex-direction:column}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .trow{display:flex;flex-direction:row;clear:left;flex-wrap:wrap;width:100%;box-sizing:border-box}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .tsingle{margin:1px;float:left}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .theader{clear:both;font-weight:bold;text-align:center;align-self:center;background-color:transparent;width:100%}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .thumbcaption{background-color:transparent}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .text-align-left{text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .text-align-right{text-align:right}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .text-align-center{text-align:center}@media all and (max-width:720px){.mw-parser-output .tmulti .thumbinner{width:100%!important;box-sizing:border-box;max-width:none!important;align-items:center}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .trow{justify-content:center}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .tsingle{float:none!important;max-width:100%!important;box-sizing:border-box;text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .tsingle .thumbcaption{text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .trow>.thumbcaption{text-align:center}}</style>
      <div class="thumb tmulti tnone center">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:692px;max-width:692px">
        <div class="trow">
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:195px;max-width:195px">
          <div class="thumbimage" style="border:none;;height:282px;overflow:hidden">

          </div>

           Regions with a traditional presence of ethnic groups other than Albanian.
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:228px;max-width:228px">

           <a href="/wiki/File:Albania_majority_ethnicity_2011_census.PNG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Albania_majority_ethnicity_2011_census.PNG/226px-Albania_majority_ethnicity_2011_census.PNG" decoding="async" width="226" height="282" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Albania_majority_ethnicity_2011_census.PNG/339px-Albania_majority_ethnicity_2011_census.PNG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Albania_majority_ethnicity_2011_census.PNG/452px-Albania_majority_ethnicity_2011_census.PNG 2x" data-file-width="582" data-file-height="726"></a>
          </div>
          <div class="thumbcaption">
