      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Language">Language</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Languages_of_Albania" title="Languages of Albania">Languages of Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       See also: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian language</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Dialect_map_albania.png" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Dialect_map_albania.png/170px-Dialect_map_albania.png" decoding="async" width="170" height="307" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Dialect_map_albania.png/255px-Dialect_map_albania.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Dialect_map_albania.png/340px-Dialect_map_albania.png 2x" data-file-width="447" data-file-height="808"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Dialect_map_albania.png" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The dialects of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian language</a> in Albania.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Official_language" title="Official language">official language</a> of the country is <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a> which is spoken by the vast majority of the country's population.<sup id="cite_ref-294" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-294">[291]</a></sup> Its standard spoken and written form is revised and merged from the two main dialects, <a href="/wiki/Gheg" class="mw-redirect" title="Gheg">Gheg</a> and <a href="/wiki/Tosk_Albanian" title="Tosk Albanian">Tosk</a>, though it is notably based more on the Tosk dialect. The <a href="/wiki/Shkumbin" title="Shkumbin">Shkumbin</a> river is the rough dividing line between the two dialects. Also a <a href="/wiki/Greeks_in_Albania#Language" title="Greeks in Albania">dialect of Greek</a> that preserves features now lost in standard <a href="/wiki/Modern_Greek" title="Modern Greek">modern Greek</a> is spoken in areas inhabited by the <a href="/wiki/Greek_minority_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Greek minority in Albania">Greek minority</a>. Other languages spoken by ethnic minorities in Albania include <a href="/wiki/Aromanian_language" title="Aromanian language">Aromanian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Serbian_language" title="Serbian language">Serbian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Macedonian_language" title="Macedonian language">Macedonian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bosnian_language" title="Bosnian language">Bosnian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bulgarian_language" title="Bulgarian language">Bulgarian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gora_dialect" title="Gora dialect">Gorani</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Romani_language" title="Romani language">Roma</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-295" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-295">[292]</a></sup> Macedonian is official in the Pustec Municipality in East Albania. According to the 2011 population census, 2,765,610 or 98.767% of the population declared <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a> as their mother tongue (<i>mother tongue is defined as the first or main language spoken at home during childhood</i>).<sup id="cite_ref-Population_and_Housing_Census_2011_2-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Population_and_Housing_Census_2011-2">[2]</a></sup> </p> 
      <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r978413945/mw-parser-output/.tmulti">
      <div class="thumb tmulti tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:204px;max-width:204px">
        <div class="trow">
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:202px;max-width:202px">
          <div class="thumbimage">
           <a href="/wiki/File:Bilingual_road_sign_directing_to_Gllobo%C3%A7eni,_written_in_both_Macedonian_and_Albanian.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Bilingual_road_sign_directing_to_Gllobo%C3%A7eni%2C_written_in_both_Macedonian_and_Albanian.jpg/200px-Bilingual_road_sign_directing_to_Gllobo%C3%A7eni%2C_written_in_both_Macedonian_and_Albanian.jpg" decoding="async" width="200" height="92" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Bilingual_road_sign_directing_to_Gllobo%C3%A7eni%2C_written_in_both_Macedonian_and_Albanian.jpg/300px-Bilingual_road_sign_directing_to_Gllobo%C3%A7eni%2C_written_in_both_Macedonian_and_Albanian.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Bilingual_road_sign_directing_to_Gllobo%C3%A7eni%2C_written_in_both_Macedonian_and_Albanian.jpg/400px-Bilingual_road_sign_directing_to_Gllobo%C3%A7eni%2C_written_in_both_Macedonian_and_Albanian.jpg 2x" data-file-width="675" data-file-height="310"></a>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="trow">
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:202px;max-width:202px">
          <div class="thumbimage">
           <a href="/wiki/File:Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg/200px-Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg" decoding="async" width="200" height="133" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg/300px-Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg/400px-Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1500" data-file-height="1000"></a>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="trow" style="display:flex">
         <div class="thumbcaption">
          One road sign in Albanian and a minority language (Macedonian) and one in Albanian and a foreign language for tourists (English) in Pustec <small>(<b>top</b>)</small> Road sign in Albanian and a minority language (Greek) in Goranxi <small>(<b>bottom</b>)</small>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>In recent years, the shrinking number of pupils in schools dedicated to the Greek minority has caused problems for teachers.<sup id="cite_ref-296" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-296">[293]</a></sup> The Greek language is spoken by an important percentage in the southern part of the country, due to cultural and economic links with adjacent Greece.<sup id="cite_ref-297" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-297">[294]</a></sup> In a 2017 study carried out by Instat, the Albanian government statistical agency, 39.9% of the 25–64 years old is able to use at least one foreign language, with English first at 40.0%, followed by Italian with 27.8% and Greek with 22.9%.<sup id="cite_ref-298" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-298">[295]</a></sup> Among young people aged 25 or less, English, German and Turkish have seen rising interest after 2000. Italian and French have had a stable interest, while Greek has lost much of its previous interest. The trends are linked with cultural and economic factors.<sup id="cite_ref-Shkurtaj2017_299-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Shkurtaj2017-299">[296]</a></sup> </p>
      <p><a href="/wiki/Greek_language" title="Greek language">Greek</a> is the second most-spoken language in the country, with 0.5 to 3% of the population speaking it as first language,<sup id="cite_ref-300" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-300">[297]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-SecondMostSpokenLanguage_301-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SecondMostSpokenLanguage-301">[298]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-kathimerini_302-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kathimerini-302">[299]</a></sup> and with two-thirds of mainly Albanian families having at least one member that speaks Greek, most having learned it in the post communist era (1992–present) due to private schools or migration to Greece.<sup id="cite_ref-kathimerini_302-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kathimerini-302">[299]</a></sup> Outside of the small designated "minority area" in the south the teaching of Greek was banned during the communist era.<sup id="cite_ref-303" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-303">[300]</a></sup> As of 2003 Greek was offered at over 100 private tutoring centers all over Albania and at a private school in Tirana, the first of its kind outside Greece.<sup id="cite_ref-kathimerini_302-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kathimerini-302">[299]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Young people have shown a growing interest in German language in recent years. Some of them go to Germany for studying or various experiences. Albania and Germany have agreements for cooperating in helping young people of the two countries know both cultures better.<sup id="cite_ref-304" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-304">[301]</a></sup> Due to a sharp rise in economic relations with Turkey, interest in learning Turkish, in particular among young people, has been growing on a yearly basis. Young people, attracted by economic importance of Turkish investments and common values between the two nations, gain from cultural and academic collaboration of universities.<sup id="cite_ref-305" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-305">[302]</a></sup> </p> 
      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Religion">Religion</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Religion_in_Albania" title="Religion in Albania">Religion in Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <table class="box-Update plainlinks metadata ambox ambox-content ambox-Update" role="presentation">
       <tbody>
        <tr>
         <td class="mbox-image">
          <div style="width:52px">
           <img alt="Ambox current red.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Ambox_current_red.svg/42px-Ambox_current_red.svg.png" decoding="async" width="42" height="34" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Ambox_current_red.svg/63px-Ambox_current_red.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Ambox_current_red.svg/84px-Ambox_current_red.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="360" data-file-height="290">
          </div></td>
         <td class="mbox-text">
          <div class="mbox-text-span">
           This section needs to be <b>updated</b>.<span class="hide-when-compact"> Please update this article to reflect recent events or newly available information.</span> <small class="date-container"><i>(<span class="date">July 2020</span>)</i></small>
          </div></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table> 
      <div class="PieChartTemplate thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:202px"> 
        <div style="background-color:white;margin:auto;position:relative;width:200px;height:200px;overflow:hidden;border-radius:100px;border:1px solid black"> 
         <div style="border:solid transparent;position:absolute;width:100px;line-height:0;left:0; top:0; border-width:0 200px 200px 0; border-color:LightBlue"></div>
         <div style="border:solid transparent;position:absolute;width:100px;line-height:0;left:100px; top:100px; border-width:100px 0 0 61.453065661725px; border-left-color:Black"></div> 
         <div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 200px 100px 0;border-color:Black"></div> 
         <div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 100px 200px 0;border-color:Black"></div>
         <div style="border:solid transparent;position:absolute;width:100px;line-height:0;left:100px; top:100px; border-width:100px 0 0 41.56865717688px; border-left-color:Red"></div> 
         <div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 200px 100px 0;border-color:Red"></div> 
         <div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 100px 200px 0;border-color:Red"></div>
         <div style="border:solid transparent;position:absolute;width:100px;line-height:0;left:100px; top:100px; border-width:100px 0 0 4.9048120705022px; border-left-color:Gold"></div> 
         <div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 200px 100px 0;border-color:Gold"></div> 
         <div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 100px 200px 0;border-color:Gold"></div>
         <div style="border:solid transparent;position:absolute;width:100px;line-height:0;right:100px; top:100px; border-width:52.463983072871px 85.132429074528px 0 0; border-top-color:Green"></div> 
         <div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 200px 100px 0;border-color:Green"></div> 
        </div> 
        <div class="thumbcaption"> 
         <p>Religion in Albania as of the 2011 census conducted by the <a href="/wiki/Institute_of_Statistics_(Albania)" title="Institute of Statistics (Albania)">Institute of Statistics</a> (INSTAT).<sup id="cite_ref-Religion_2011_Census_306-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Religion_2011_Census-306">[303]</a></sup> </p> 
         <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r981673959">.mw-parser-output .legend{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .legend-color{display:inline-block;min-width:1.25em;height:1.25em;line-height:1.25;margin:1px 0;text-align:center;border:1px solid black;background-color:transparent;color:black}.mw-parser-output .legend-text{}</style>
         <div class="legend">
          <span class="legend-color" style="background-color:Green; color:white;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Islam_in_Albania" title="Islam in Albania">Islam</a> (58.79%)
         </div>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r981673959">
         <div class="legend">
          <span class="legend-color" style="background-color:Gold; color:black;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Christianity_in_Albania" title="Christianity in Albania">Christianity</a> (16.99%)
         </div>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r981673959">
         <div class="legend">
          <span class="legend-color" style="background-color:Red; color:black;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;No Denomination (5.49%)
         </div>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r981673959">
         <div class="legend">
          <span class="legend-color" style="background-color:Black; color:white;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Irreligion_in_Albania" title="Irreligion in Albania">Irreligion</a> (2.5%)
         </div>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r981673959">
         <div class="legend">
          <span class="legend-color" style="background-color:LightBlue; color:black;">&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;Unclear (16.24%)
         </div> 
        </div> 
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Albania is a <a href="/wiki/Secular_state" title="Secular state">secular</a> and religiously diverse country with no <a href="/wiki/Official_religion" class="mw-redirect" title="Official religion">official religion</a> and thus, <a href="/wiki/Freedom_of_religion" title="Freedom of religion">freedom of religion</a>, <a href="/wiki/Freedom_of_belief" class="mw-redirect" title="Freedom of belief">belief</a> and <a href="/wiki/Freedom_of_conscience" class="mw-redirect" title="Freedom of conscience">conscience</a> are guaranteed under the country's <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Albania" title="Constitution of Albania">constitution</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-307" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-307">[304]</a></sup> Culturally, <a href="/wiki/Religious_tolerance" title="Religious tolerance">religious tolerance</a> is one of the most considerable values of the tradition of the <a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a>. It is widely accepted that they generally value a peaceful coexistence among the believers of different religious communities in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-308" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-308">[305]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-309" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-309">[306]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Pope_Francis" title="Pope Francis">Pope Francis</a> hailed Albania during his <a href="/wiki/Official_visit" class="mw-redirect" title="Official visit">official visit</a> in <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> as model of religious harmony, due to the long tradition of religious coexistence and tolerance.<sup id="cite_ref-310" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-310">[307]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>During <a href="/wiki/Classical_antiquity" title="Classical antiquity">classical times</a>, there are thought to have been about seventy Christian families in <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>, as early as the time of the <a href="/wiki/Apostle" title="Apostle">Apostles</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-311" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-311">[308]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Archdiocese_of_Tiran%C3%AB-Durr%C3%ABs" title="Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Tiranë-Durrës">Archbishopric of Durrës</a> was purportedly founded by <a href="/wiki/Paul_the_Apostle" title="Paul the Apostle">Paul the Apostle</a>, while preaching in <a href="/wiki/Illyria" title="Illyria">Illyria</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ancient_epirus" class="mw-redirect" title="Ancient epirus">Epirus</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-ChHistory_312-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ChHistory-312">[309]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-313" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-313">[310]</a></sup> Meanwhile, in <a href="/wiki/Middle_Ages" title="Middle Ages">medieval times</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian people">Albanian people</a> first appeared within historical records from the <a href="/wiki/Byzantine" class="mw-redirect" title="Byzantine">Byzantines</a>. At this point, they were mostly <a href="/wiki/Christianised" class="mw-redirect" title="Christianised">Christianised</a>. <a href="/wiki/Islam" title="Islam">Islam</a> arrived for the first time in the late 9th century to the region, when <a href="/wiki/Arabs" title="Arabs">Arabs</a> raided parts of the eastern banks of the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-314" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-314">[311]</a></sup> It later emerged as the majority religion, during centuries of <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman rule</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Merdjanova673940_315-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Merdjanova673940-315">[312]</a></sup> though a significant Christian minority remained. </p>
      <p>During <a href="/wiki/Modern_history" class="mw-redirect" title="Modern history">modern times</a>, the Albanian republican, monarchic and later communist regimes followed a systematic policy of separating religion from official functions and cultural life. The country has never had an <a href="/wiki/Official_religion" class="mw-redirect" title="Official religion">official religion</a> either as a republic or as a kingdom. In the 20th century, the clergy of all faiths was weakened under the monarchy and ultimately eradicated during the 1950s and 1960s, under the state policy of obliterating all organised religion from the territories of Albania. The <a href="/wiki/Communism_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Communism in Albania">communist regime</a> persecuted and suppressed religious observance and institutions and entirely <a href="/wiki/Anti-religious" class="mw-redirect" title="Anti-religious">banned religion</a>. The country was then officially declared to be the world's first <a href="/wiki/Atheist_state" class="mw-redirect" title="Atheist state">atheist state</a>. Religious freedom has returned, however, since the <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">end of communism</a>. </p>
      <p>Islam survived communist era persecution and reemerged in the modern era as a practised religion in Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-Merdjanova673940_315-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Merdjanova673940-315">[312]</a></sup> Some smaller Christian sects in Albania include <a href="/wiki/Evangelicalism" title="Evangelicalism">Evangelicals</a> and several <a href="/wiki/Protestant" class="mw-redirect" title="Protestant">Protestant</a> communities including <a href="/wiki/Seventh-day_Adventist_Church" title="Seventh-day Adventist Church">Seventh-day Adventist Church</a>, <a href="/wiki/The_Church_of_Jesus_Christ_of_Latter-day_Saints" title="The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints">Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints</a> and <a href="/wiki/Jehovah%27s_Witnesses" title="Jehovah's Witnesses">Jehovah's Witnesses</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-316" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-316">[313]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-317" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-317">[314]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-318" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-318">[315]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-319" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-319">[316]</a></sup> The first recorded Protestant of Albania was Said Toptani, who travelled around Europe and returned to <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> in 1853, where he preached <a href="/wiki/Protestantism" title="Protestantism">Protestantism</a>. Due to that, he was arrested and imprisoned by the Ottoman authorities in 1864. The first <a href="/wiki/Evangelical_Protestants" class="mw-redirect" title="Evangelical Protestants">evangelical Protestants</a> appeared in the 19th century and the Evangelical Alliance was founded in 1892. Nowadays, it has 160 member congregations from different Protestant denominations. Following mass emigration to Israel after the fall of communism, there are only 200 Albanian <a href="/wiki/Judaism_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Judaism in Albania">Jews</a> left in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-320" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-320">[317]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-321" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-321">[318]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>As of the <a href="/wiki/2011_Census_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="2011 Census of Albania">2011 census</a>, there were 1,587,608 (56.7%) <a href="/wiki/Islam" title="Islam">Sunni Muslims</a>, 280,921 (10.03%) <a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholicism" class="mw-redirect" title="Roman Catholicism">Roman Catholics</a>, 188,992 (6.75%) <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Orthodoxy" class="mw-redirect" title="Eastern Orthodoxy">Eastern Orthodox</a>, 58,628 (2.09%) <a href="/wiki/Bektashi_Order" title="Bektashi Order">Bektashi Muslims</a>, 3,797 (0.14%) <a href="/wiki/Evangelicalism" title="Evangelicalism">Evangelicals</a>, 1,919 (0.07%) other <a href="/wiki/Christians" title="Christians">Christians</a>, 602 (0.02%) of other religions and 153,630 (5.49%) believers without denomination.<sup id="cite_ref-Religion_2011_Census_306-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Religion_2011_Census-306">[303]</a></sup> 69,995 people (2.5%) were <a href="/wiki/Atheism" title="Atheism">irreligious</a> while 386,024 (13.79%) did not declare their religion.<sup id="cite_ref-Religion_2011_Census_306-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Religion_2011_Census-306">[303]</a></sup> The country is ranked among the least religious countries in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-322" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-322">[319]</a></sup> Religion plays an important role in the lives of only 39% of its population.<sup id="cite_ref-323" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-323">[320]</a></sup> In another report, 56% considered themselves religious, 30% considered themselves non-religious, while 9% defined themselves as convinced atheists. 80% believed in God and 40% believed in life after death. However, 40% believed in hell, while 42% believed in heaven.<sup id="cite_ref-324" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-324">[321]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The preliminary results of the 2011 census seemed to give widely different results, with 70% of respondents refusing to declare belief in any of the listed faiths.<sup id="cite_ref-325" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-325">[322]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-326" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-326">[323]</a></sup> The Albanian Orthodox Church officially refused to recognize the results, claiming that 24% of the total population adhered to its faith.<sup id="cite_ref-327" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-327">[324]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-328" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-328">[325]</a></sup> Some Muslim Community officials expressed unhappiness with the data claiming that many Muslims were not counted and that the number of adherents numbered some 70% of the Albanian population.<sup id="cite_ref-329" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-329">[326]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Jazexhi22_330-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jazexhi22-330">[327]</a></sup> The Albanian Catholic Bishops Conference also cast doubts on the census, complaining that many of its believers were not contacted.<sup id="cite_ref-331" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-331">[328]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Islam_in_Albania" title="Islam in Albania">Muslim Albanians</a> are spread throughout the country. <a href="/wiki/Orthodoxy_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Orthodoxy in Albania">Orthodox</a> and <a href="/wiki/Bektashi" class="mw-redirect" title="Bektashi">Bektashis</a> are mostly found in the south, whereas <a href="/wiki/Catholicism_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Catholicism in Albania">Catholics</a> mainly live in the north.<sup id="cite_ref-International_Religious_Freedom_Report_2007_332-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-International_Religious_Freedom_Report_2007-332">[329]</a></sup> In 2008, there were 694 <a href="/wiki/Catholic" class="mw-redirect" title="Catholic">Catholic</a> churches and 425 <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Orthodox_Church" title="Eastern Orthodox Church">orthodox</a> churches, 568 mosques and 70 <a href="/wiki/Bektashi_Order" title="Bektashi Order">bektashi</a> <a href="/wiki/Khanqah" title="Khanqah">tekkes</a> in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-333" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-333">[330]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-334" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-334">[331]</a></sup> </p> 
      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Culture">Culture</span></h2> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Culture_of_Albania" title="Culture of Albania">Culture of Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Symbols">Symbols</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/National_symbols_of_Albania" title="National symbols of Albania">National symbols of Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <table class="box-More_citations_needed plainlinks metadata ambox ambox-content ambox-Refimprove" role="presentation">
       <tbody>
        <tr>
         <td class="mbox-image">
          <div style="width:52px">
           <a href="/wiki/File:Question_book-new.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/50px-Question_book-new.svg.png" decoding="async" width="50" height="39" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/75px-Question_book-new.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/100px-Question_book-new.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="512" data-file-height="399"></a>
          </div></td>
         <td class="mbox-text">
          <div class="mbox-text-span">
           This section <b>needs additional citations for <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability" title="Wikipedia:Verifiability">verification</a></b>.<span class="hide-when-compact"> Please help <a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Albania&amp;action=edit">improve this article</a> by <a href="/wiki/Help:Referencing_for_beginners" title="Help:Referencing for beginners">adding citations to reliable sources</a>. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed.<br><small><span class="plainlinks"><i>Find sources:</i>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?as_eq=wikipedia&amp;q=%22Albania%22">"Albania"</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?tbm=nws&amp;q=%22Albania%22+-wikipedia">news</a>&nbsp;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?&amp;q=%22Albania%22+site:news.google.com/newspapers&amp;source=newspapers">newspapers</a>&nbsp;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?tbs=bks:1&amp;q=%22Albania%22+-wikipedia">books</a>&nbsp;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22Albania%22">scholar</a>&nbsp;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/action/doBasicSearch?Query=%22Albania%22&amp;acc=on&amp;wc=on">JSTOR</a></span></small></span> <small class="date-container"><i>(<span class="date">February 2020</span>)</i></small><small class="hide-when-compact"><i> (<a href="/wiki/Help:Maintenance_template_removal" title="Help:Maintenance template removal">Learn how and when to remove this template message</a>)</i></small>
          </div></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Doppeladler_Albanien.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/Doppeladler_Albanien.jpg/220px-Doppeladler_Albanien.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="159" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/Doppeladler_Albanien.jpg/330px-Doppeladler_Albanien.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/Doppeladler_Albanien.jpg/440px-Doppeladler_Albanien.jpg 2x" data-file-width="994" data-file-height="720"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Doppeladler_Albanien.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The <a href="/wiki/Double-headed_eagle" title="Double-headed eagle">double-headed eagle</a> on the walls of the <a href="/wiki/St._Anthony_Church,_Durr%C3%ABs" title="St. Anthony Church, Durrës">St. Anthony Church</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Albania shares many symbols associated with its history, culture and belief. These include the colours red and black, animals such as the <a href="/wiki/Golden_eagle" title="Golden eagle">golden eagle</a> living across the country, costumes such as the <a href="/wiki/Fustanella" title="Fustanella">fustanella</a>, <a href="/wiki/Qeleshe" title="Qeleshe">plis</a> and <a href="/wiki/Opinga" title="Opinga">opinga</a> which are worn to special events and celebrations, plants such as the <a href="/wiki/Olive" title="Olive">olive</a> and <a href="/wiki/Papaver_rhoeas" title="Papaver rhoeas">red poppy</a> growing as well across the country. </p>
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Flag_of_Albania" title="Flag of Albania">flag of Albania</a> is a red flag with a black <a href="/wiki/Double-headed_eagle" title="Double-headed eagle">double-headed eagle</a> positioned in the centre.<sup id="cite_ref-Flamuri_335-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Flamuri-335">[332]</a></sup> The red colour used in the flag symbolises the bravery, strength and valour of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian people">Albanian people</a>, while the black colour appears as a symbol of freedom and heroism.<sup id="cite_ref-Flamuri_335-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Flamuri-335">[332]</a></sup> The eagle has been used by Albanians since the <a href="/wiki/Middle_Ages" title="Middle Ages">Middle Ages</a> including the establishment of the <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Arb%C3%ABr" class="mw-redirect" title="Principality of Arbër">Principality of Arbër</a> and by numerous noble ruling families such as the <a href="/wiki/Kastrioti_family" class="mw-redirect" title="Kastrioti family">Kastrioti</a>, <a href="/wiki/Muzaka_family" title="Muzaka family">Muzaka</a>, <a href="/wiki/Thopia_family" title="Thopia family">Thopia</a> and <a href="/wiki/Dukagjini_family" title="Dukagjini family">Dukagjini</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-336" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-336">[333]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Gjergj_Kastrioti_Sk%C3%ABnderbeu" class="mw-redirect" title="Gjergj Kastrioti Skënderbeu">Gjergj Kastrioti Skënderbeu</a>, who fought and began a rebellion against the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman Empire</a> which halted Ottoman advance into Europe for nearly 25 years, placed the double-headed eagle on his flag and seal.<sup id="cite_ref-337" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-337">[334]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-338" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-338">[335]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The country's national motto, <i><a href="/wiki/Ti_Shqip%C3%ABri,_m%C3%AB_jep_nder,_m%C3%AB_jep_emrin_Shqip%C3%ABtar" title="Ti Shqipëri, më jep nder, më jep emrin Shqipëtar">Ti Shqipëri, më jep nder, më jep emrin Shqipëtar</a></i> ("You Albania, you give me honour, you give me the name Albanian"), finds its origins in the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_National_Awakening" title="Albanian National Awakening">Albanian National Awakening</a>. The first to express this motto was <a href="/wiki/Naim_Frash%C3%ABri" title="Naim Frashëri">Naim Frashëri</a> in his poem <i>Ti Shqipëri më jep nder</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-339" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-339">[336]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Arts">Arts</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_art" title="Albanian art">Albanian art</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_architecture" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian architecture">architecture</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg/220px-Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg/330px-Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg/440px-Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3872" data-file-height="2592"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Butrint" title="Butrint">Butrint</a> has been included in the <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> list of <a href="/wiki/World_Heritage_Site" title="World Heritage Site">World Heritage Sites</a> since 1992.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_art" title="Albanian art">artistic history</a> of Albania has been particularly influenced by a multitude of ancient and medieval <a href="/wiki/Civilisation" class="mw-redirect" title="Civilisation">people</a>, traditions and religions. It covers a broad spectrum with mediums and disciplines that include painting, <a href="/wiki/Pottery" title="Pottery">pottery</a>, sculpture, <a href="/wiki/Ceramic" title="Ceramic">ceramics</a> and architecture all of them exemplifying a great variety in style and shape, in different regions and period. </p>
      <p>The rise of the <a href="/wiki/Byzantine_Empire" title="Byzantine Empire">Byzantine</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman Empire</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Middle_Ages" title="Middle Ages">Middle Ages</a> was accompanied by a corresponding growth in <a href="/wiki/Christian_art" title="Christian art">Christian</a> and <a href="/wiki/Islamic_art" title="Islamic art">Islamic art</a> in the lands of Albania which are apparent in examples of architecture and mosaics throughout the country.<sup id="cite_ref-www.albanianart.net_index_al_340-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-www.albanianart.net_index_al-340">[337]</a></sup> Centuries later, the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Renaissance" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Renaissance">Albanian Renaissance</a> proved crucial to the emancipation of the modern Albanian culture and saw unprecedented developments in all fields of literature and art whereas artists sought to return to the ideals of <a href="/wiki/Impressionism" title="Impressionism">Impressionism</a> and <a href="/wiki/Romanticism_(art)" class="mw-redirect" title="Romanticism (art)">Romanticism</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-341" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-341">[338]</a></sup> However, <a href="/wiki/Onufri" title="Onufri">Onufri</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kol%C3%AB_Idromeno" title="Kolë Idromeno">Kolë Idromeno</a>, <a href="/wiki/David_Selenica" title="David Selenica">David Selenica</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kostandin_Shpataraku" title="Kostandin Shpataraku">Kostandin Shpataraku</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Zografi_Brothers" title="Zografi Brothers">Zografi Brothers</a> are the most eminent representatives of Albanian art. </p> 
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg/220px-Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="211" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg/330px-Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg/440px-Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2800" data-file-height="2690"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The <a href="/wiki/Codices_of_Berat" class="mw-redirect" title="Codices of Berat">Codices of Berat</a> are eminently important for the global community and the development of ancient <a href="/wiki/Biblical" class="mw-redirect" title="Biblical">biblical</a>, <a href="/wiki/Liturgical" class="mw-redirect" title="Liturgical">liturgical</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hagiography" title="Hagiography">hagiographical</a> literature.<sup id="cite_ref-342" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-342">[339]</a></sup> In 2005, it was inscribed on the <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Memory_of_the_World_Register" class="mw-redirect" title="Memory of the World Register">Memory of the World Register</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Architecture_of_Albania" title="Architecture of Albania">architecture of Albania</a> reflects the legacy of various civilisations tracing back to the <a href="/wiki/Classical_antiquity" title="Classical antiquity">classical antiquity</a>. Major cities in Albania have evolved from within the castle to include dwellings, religious and commercial structures, with constant redesigning of town squares and evolution of building techniques. Nowadays, the cities and towns reflect a whole spectrum of various <a href="/wiki/Architectural_style" title="Architectural style">architectural styles</a>. In the 20th century, many historical as well as <a href="/wiki/Sacred_architecture" class="mw-redirect" title="Sacred architecture">sacred</a> buildings bearing the ancient influence were demolished during the <a href="/wiki/Communism_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Communism in Albania">communist era</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-343" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-343">[340]</a></sup> </p>
      <p><a href="/wiki/Ancient_architecture" class="mw-redirect" title="Ancient architecture">Ancient architecture</a> is found throughout Albania and most visible in <a href="/wiki/Byllis" title="Byllis">Byllis</a>, <a href="/wiki/Amantia" title="Amantia">Amantia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Phoenice" title="Phoenice">Phoenice</a>, <a href="/wiki/Apollonia_(Illyria)" title="Apollonia (Illyria)">Apollonia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Butrint" title="Butrint">Butrint</a>, <a href="/wiki/Antigonia_(Chaonia)" title="Antigonia (Chaonia)">Antigonia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rozafa_Castle" title="Rozafa Castle">Shkodër</a> and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs_Amphitheatre" class="mw-redirect" title="Durrës Amphitheatre">Durrës</a>. Considering the long period of rule of the <a href="/wiki/Byzantine_Empire" title="Byzantine Empire">Byzantine Empire</a>, they introduced castles, citadels, churches and monasteries with spectacular wealth of visible <a href="/wiki/Mural" title="Mural">murals</a> and <a href="/wiki/Fresco" title="Fresco">frescos</a>. Perhaps the best known examples can be found in the southern Albanian cities and surroundings of <a href="/wiki/Kor%C3%A7%C3%AB" title="Korçë">Korçë</a>, <a href="/wiki/Berat" title="Berat">Berat</a>, <a href="/wiki/Voskopoj%C3%AB" class="mw-redirect" title="Voskopojë">Voskopojë</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gjirokast%C3%ABr" title="Gjirokastër">Gjirokastër</a>. Involving the introduction of <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_architecture" title="Ottoman architecture">Ottoman architecture</a> there was a development of mosques and other Islamic buildings, particularly seen in Berat and Gjirokastër. </p> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg/220px-Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg/330px-Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg/440px-Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1600" data-file-height="1067"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The <a href="/wiki/Fortress_of_Bashtov%C3%AB" title="Fortress of Bashtovë">Fortress of Bashtovë</a> is on the <a href="/wiki/List_of_World_Heritage_Sites_in_Albania#Tentative_list" title="List of World Heritage Sites in Albania">tentative list</a> for inscribing it as a <a href="/wiki/UNESCO_World_Heritage_Site" class="mw-redirect" title="UNESCO World Heritage Site">UNESCO World Heritage Site</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-344" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-344">[341]</a></sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>A productive period of <a href="/wiki/Historicism_(art)" title="Historicism (art)">Historicism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Art_Nouveau" title="Art Nouveau">Art Nouveau</a> and <a href="/wiki/Neoclassicism" title="Neoclassicism">Neoclassicism</a> merged into the 19th century, best exemplified in <a href="/wiki/Kor%C3%A7%C3%AB" title="Korçë">Korçë</a>. The 20th century brought new architectural styles such as the modern <a href="/wiki/Italianate_architecture" title="Italianate architecture">Italian style</a>, which is present in <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> such as the <a href="/wiki/Skanderbeg_Square" title="Skanderbeg Square">Skanderbeg Square</a> and Ministries. It is also present in Shkodër, <a href="/wiki/Vlor%C3%AB" title="Vlorë">Vlorë</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sarand%C3%AB" title="Sarandë">Sarandë</a> and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>. Moreover, other towns received their present-day Albania-unique appearance through various cultural or economic influences. </p>
      <p><a href="/wiki/Socialist_classicism" class="mw-redirect" title="Socialist classicism">Socialist classicism</a> arrived during the <a href="/wiki/Peoples_Republic_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Peoples Republic of Albania">communist era</a> in Albania after the <a href="/wiki/Second_World_War" class="mw-redirect" title="Second World War">Second World War</a>. At this period many socialist-styled complexes, wide roads and factories were constructed, while town squares were redesigned and numerous of historic and important buildings demolished. Notable examples of that style include the <a href="/wiki/Mother_Teresa_Square_(Tirana)" title="Mother Teresa Square (Tirana)">Mother Teresa Square</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pyramid_of_Tirana" title="Pyramid of Tirana">Pyramid of Tirana</a>, <a href="/wiki/Palace_of_Congresses" title="Palace of Congresses">Palace of Congresses</a> and so on. </p>
      <p>Three Albanian archaeological sites are included in the list of <a href="/wiki/UNESCO_World_Heritage_Site" class="mw-redirect" title="UNESCO World Heritage Site">UNESCO World Heritage Sites</a>. These include the ancient remains of Butrint, the medieval <a href="/wiki/Historic_Centres_of_Berat_and_Gjirokast%C3%ABr" title="Historic Centres of Berat and Gjirokastër">Historic Centres of Berat and Gjirokastër</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Ohrid_Lake" class="mw-redirect" title="Ohrid Lake">Natural and Cultural Heritage of the Ohrid region</a> site shared with <a href="/wiki/North_Macedonia" title="North Macedonia">North Macedonia</a> since 2019.<sup id="cite_ref-345" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-345">[342]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-346" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-346">[343]</a></sup> Furthermore, the royal <a href="/wiki/Royal_Tombs_of_Selca_e_Poshtme" title="Royal Tombs of Selca e Poshtme">Illyrian tombs</a>, the remains of <a href="/wiki/Apollonia_(Illyria)" title="Apollonia (Illyria)">Apollonia</a>, the ancient <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs_Amphitheatre" class="mw-redirect" title="Durrës Amphitheatre">Amphitheatre</a> of Durrës and the <a href="/wiki/Fortress_of_Bashtov%C3%AB" title="Fortress of Bashtovë">Fortress of Bashtovë</a> has been included on the tentative list of Albania. </p> 
      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Cuisine">Cuisine</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_cuisine" title="Albanian cuisine">Albanian cuisine</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe,_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG/220px-Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG/330px-Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG/440px-Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG 2x" data-file-width="4000" data-file-height="3000"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe,_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>Bukë misri (<a href="/wiki/Cornbread" title="Cornbread">cornbread</a>) is a staple on the Albanian table.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Throughout the centuries, <a href="/wiki/Albanian_cuisine" title="Albanian cuisine">Albanian cuisine</a> has been widely influenced by <a href="/wiki/Albanian_culture" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian culture">Albanian culture</a>, <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Albania" title="Geography of Albania">geography</a> and <a href="/wiki/History_of_Albania" title="History of Albania">history</a>, and as such, different parts of the country enjoy specific <a href="/wiki/Regional_cuisine" title="Regional cuisine">regional cuisines</a>. Cooking traditions especially vary between the north and the south, owing to differing <a href="/wiki/Topography" title="Topography">topography</a> and <a href="/wiki/Climate" title="Climate">climate</a> that essentially contribute to the excellent growth conditions for a wide array of herbs, fruits, and vegetables.<sup id="cite_ref-347" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-347">[344]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Albanians produce and use many varieties of fruits such as <a href="/wiki/Lemon_(fruit)" class="mw-redirect" title="Lemon (fruit)">lemons</a>, oranges, <a href="/wiki/Figs_(fruit)" class="mw-redirect" title="Figs (fruit)">figs</a>, and most notably, <a href="/wiki/Olive_(fruit)" class="mw-redirect" title="Olive (fruit)">olives</a>, which are perhaps the most important element of Albanian cooking. Spices and other herbs such as <a href="/wiki/Basil_(herb)" class="mw-redirect" title="Basil (herb)">basil</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lavender" class="mw-redirect" title="Lavender">lavender</a>, <a href="/wiki/Spearmint" title="Spearmint">mint</a>, <a href="/wiki/Oregano" title="Oregano">oregano</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rosemary" title="Rosemary">rosemary</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Thyme" title="Thyme">thyme</a> are widely used, as are vegetables such as garlic, onions, <a href="/wiki/Bell_pepper" title="Bell pepper">peppers</a>, potatoes, tomatoes, as well as <a href="/wiki/Legume" title="Legume">legumes</a> of all types. </p>
      <p>With a coastline along the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Adriatic_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast">Adriatic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Ionian_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Ionian Sea Coast">Ionian</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea" title="Mediterranean Sea">Mediterranean Sea</a>, fish, <a href="/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">crustaceans</a>, and seafood are a popular and an integral part of the Albanian diet. Otherwise, <a href="/wiki/Lamb_(food)" class="mw-redirect" title="Lamb (food)">lamb</a> is the traditional meat for different holidays and <a href="/wiki/Religious_festival" title="Religious festival">religious festivals</a> for both <a href="/wiki/Christianity_in_Albania" title="Christianity in Albania">Christians</a> and <a href="/wiki/Islam_in_Albania" title="Islam in Albania">Muslims</a>, although poultry, beef, and pork are also in plentiful supply. </p> 
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg/220px-Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="211" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg/330px-Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg/440px-Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3456" data-file-height="3314"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>Speca të ferguara (roasted <a href="/wiki/Capsicum" title="Capsicum">peppers</a>) served with <a href="/wiki/Pite_(food)" class="mw-redirect" title="Pite (food)">pite</a>, a traditional and prominent layered Albanian pie.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p><a href="/wiki/Tav%C3%AB_kosi" title="Tavë kosi">Tavë kosi</a> ("<a href="/wiki/Soured_milk" title="Soured milk">soured milk</a> <a href="/wiki/Casserole" title="Casserole">casserole</a>") is the <a href="/wiki/National_dish" title="National dish">national dish</a> of Albania, consisting of lamb and rice baked under a thick, tart veil of <a href="/wiki/Yogurt" title="Yogurt">yogurt</a>. Fërgesë is another national dish, made up of peppers, tomatoes, and <a href="/wiki/Cottage_cheese" title="Cottage cheese">cottage cheese</a>. Pite is also popular, a baked pastry with a filling of a mixture of <a href="/wiki/Spinach" title="Spinach">spinach</a> and gjizë (curd) or mish (<a href="/wiki/Ground_meat" title="Ground meat">ground meat</a>). </p>
      <p>Petulla, a traditional fried dough, is also a popular speciality, and is served with <a href="/wiki/Powdered_sugar" title="Powdered sugar">powdered sugar</a> or <a href="/wiki/Feta_cheese" class="mw-redirect" title="Feta cheese">feta cheese</a> and different sorts of <a href="/wiki/Fruit_preserves" title="Fruit preserves">fruit jams</a>. <a href="/wiki/Flia" title="Flia">Flia</a> consists of multiple <a href="/wiki/Cr%C3%AApe" title="Crêpe">crêpe</a>-like layers brushed with cream and served with sour cream. <a href="/wiki/Krofne" title="Krofne">Krofne</a>, similar to <a href="/wiki/Berliner_(doughnut)" title="Berliner (doughnut)">Berliner doughnuts</a>, are filled with jam, or chocolate and often eaten during cold winter months. </p>
      <p>Coffee is an integral part of the Albanian lifestyle. The country has more coffee houses per capita than any other country in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-348" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-348">[345]</a></sup> Tea is also enjoyed both at home or outside at cafés, bars, or restaurants. Çaj Mali (<a href="/wiki/Sideritis" title="Sideritis">Sideritis</a> tea) is enormously beloved, and a part of the daily routine for most Albanians. It is cultivated across Southern Albania and noted for its medicinal properties. <a href="/wiki/Black_tea" title="Black tea">Black tea</a> with a slice of lemon and sugar, milk, or honey is also popular. </p>
      <p><a href="/wiki/Albanian_wine" title="Albanian wine">Albanian wine</a> is also common throughout the country, and has been cultivated for thousands of years. Albania has a long and ancient history of wine production, and belongs to the <a href="/wiki/Old_World_wine" title="Old World wine">Old World of wine producing countries</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-349" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-349">[346]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-350" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-350">[347]</a></sup> Its wine is characterized by its sweet taste and traditionally indigenous varieties. </p> 
      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Media">Media</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Media_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Media in Albania">Media in Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       See also: <a href="/wiki/Cinema_of_Albania" title="Cinema of Albania">Cinema of Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Villa_of_the_former_Radio_Tirana_(03).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Villa_of_the_former_Radio_Tirana_%2803%29.jpg/220px-Villa_of_the_former_Radio_Tirana_%2803%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="125" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Villa_of_the_former_Radio_Tirana_%2803%29.jpg/330px-Villa_of_the_former_Radio_Tirana_%2803%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Villa_of_the_former_Radio_Tirana_%2803%29.jpg/440px-Villa_of_the_former_Radio_Tirana_%2803%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5604" data-file-height="3172"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Villa_of_the_former_Radio_Tirana_(03).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The former grounds of the headquarters of <a href="/wiki/Radio_Tirana" class="mw-redirect" title="Radio Tirana">Radio Tirana</a> in the capital of <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a>. <a href="/wiki/Radio_Televizioni_Shqiptar" class="mw-redirect" title="Radio Televizioni Shqiptar">Radio Televizioni Shqiptar</a> (RTSH) was initially inaugurated as Radio Tirana in 1938 prior to the <a href="/wiki/World_War_II" title="World War II">World War II</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Freedom_of_press" class="mw-redirect" title="Freedom of press">freedom of press</a> and <a href="/wiki/Freedom_of_speech" title="Freedom of speech">speech</a>, and the right to free expression is guaranteed in the <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Albania" title="Constitution of Albania">constitution of Albania</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-351" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-351">[348]</a></sup> Albania was ranked 84th on the <a href="/wiki/Press_Freedom_Index" title="Press Freedom Index">Press Freedom Index</a> of 2020 compiled by the <a href="/wiki/Reporters_Without_Borders" title="Reporters Without Borders">Reporters Without Borders</a>, with its score steadily declining since 2003.<sup id="cite_ref-352" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-352">[349]</a></sup> Nevertheless, in the 2020 report of <a href="/wiki/Freedom_in_the_World" title="Freedom in the World">Freedom in the World</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Freedom_House" title="Freedom House">Freedom House</a> classified the freedoms of press and speech in Albania as partly free from political interference and manipulation.<sup id="cite_ref-353" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-353">[350]</a></sup> </p>
      <p><a href="/wiki/Radio_Televizioni_Shqiptar" class="mw-redirect" title="Radio Televizioni Shqiptar">Radio Televizioni Shqiptar</a> (RTSH) is the <a href="/wiki/National_broadcaster" class="mw-redirect" title="National broadcaster">national broadcaster</a> corporation of Albania operating numerous television and radio stations in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-354" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-354">[351]</a></sup> The three major private broadcaster corporations are <a href="/wiki/Top_Channel" title="Top Channel">Top Channel</a>, <a href="/wiki/TV_Klan" class="mw-redirect" title="TV Klan">Televizioni Klan</a> and <a href="/wiki/Vizion_Plus" title="Vizion Plus">Vizion Plus</a> whose content are distributed throughout Albania and beyond its territory in <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a> and other <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian-speaking</a> territories.<sup id="cite_ref-CIA_demography_264-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CIA_demography-264">[261]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Albanian cinema has its roots in the 20th century and developed after the country's <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Declaration_of_Independence" title="Albanian Declaration of Independence">declaration of independence</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Cinema_355-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cinema-355">[352]</a></sup> The first <a href="/wiki/Movie_theater" title="Movie theater">movie theater</a> exclusively devoted to showing <a href="/wiki/Motion_pictures" class="mw-redirect" title="Motion pictures">motion pictures</a> was built in 1912 in <a href="/wiki/Shkod%C3%ABr" title="Shkodër">Shkodër</a> by an Austrian distribution company with strong efforts by Albanian painter <a href="/wiki/Kol%C3%AB_Idromeno" title="Kolë Idromeno">Kolë Idromeno</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Cinema_355-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cinema-355">[352]</a></sup> The opening of other movie theaters followed by 1920 in Shkodër, <a href="/wiki/Berat" title="Berat">Berat</a>, Tirana and <a href="/wiki/Vlor%C3%AB" title="Vlorë">Vlorë</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Cinema_355-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cinema-355">[352]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>During the <a href="/wiki/Peoples_Republic_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Peoples Republic of Albania">Peoples Republic of Albania</a>, Albanian cinema developed rapidly with the inauguration of the <a href="/wiki/Kinostudio_Shqip%C3%ABria_e_Re" class="mw-redirect" title="Kinostudio Shqipëria e Re">Kinostudio Shqipëria e Re</a> in Tirana.<sup id="cite_ref-Cinema_355-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cinema-355">[352]</a></sup> In 1953, the Albanian-Soviet <a href="/wiki/Epic_film" title="Epic film">epic film</a>, the <a href="/wiki/The_Great_Warrior_Skanderbeg" title="The Great Warrior Skanderbeg">Great Warrior Skanderbeg</a>, was released chronicling the life and fight of the medieval Albanian hero <a href="/wiki/Gjergj_Kastriot_Skanderbeg" class="mw-redirect" title="Gjergj Kastriot Skanderbeg">Skanderbeg</a>. It went on to win the international prize at the <a href="/wiki/1954_Cannes_Film_Festival" title="1954 Cannes Film Festival">1954 Cannes Film Festival</a>. In 2003, the <a href="/wiki/Tirana_International_Film_Festival" title="Tirana International Film Festival">Tirana International Film Festival</a> was established, the largest film festival in the country. <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a> is host to the <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs_International_Film_Festival" class="mw-redirect" title="Durrës International Film Festival">Durrës International Film Festival</a>, the second largest film festival, taking place at the <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs_Amphitheatre" class="mw-redirect" title="Durrës Amphitheatre">Durrës Amphitheatre</a>. </p> 
      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Music">Music</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Music_of_Albania" title="Music of Albania">Music of Albania</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG/220px-A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG/330px-A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG/440px-A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG 2x" data-file-width="2048" data-file-height="1536"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Albanian_iso-polyphony" title="Albanian iso-polyphony">Albanian iso-polyphony</a> is designated as an <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> <a href="/wiki/Masterpieces_of_the_Oral_and_Intangible_Heritage_of_Humanity" title="Masterpieces of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity">Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-356" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-356">[353]</a></sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Albanian folk music is a prominent part of the national identity, and continues to play a major part in overall <a href="/wiki/Music_of_Albania" title="Music of Albania">Albanian music</a>. Folk music can be divided into two stylistic groups, mainly the northern <a href="/wiki/Gheg_Albanian" title="Gheg Albanian">Gheg</a> varieties, and southern <a href="/wiki/Lab%C3%ABria" title="Labëria">Lab</a> and <a href="/wiki/Tosk_Albanian" title="Tosk Albanian">Tosk</a> varieties. Northern and southern traditions are contrasted by a rugged tone from the north, and the more relaxed southern form of music. </p>
      <p>Many songs concern events from <a href="/wiki/History_of_Albania" title="History of Albania">Albanian history</a> and <a href="/wiki/Culture_of_Albania" title="Culture of Albania">culture</a>, including traditional themes of honour, hospitality, treachery, and revenge. The first compilation of Albanian folk music was made by two <a href="/wiki/Himara" title="Himara">Himariot</a> musicians, <a href="/wiki/Ne%C3%A7o_Muko" title="Neço Muko">Neço Muka</a> and Koço Çakali, in Paris, during their work with Albanian soprano <a href="/wiki/Tefta_Tashko-Ko%C3%A7o" title="Tefta Tashko-Koço">Tefta Tashko-Koço</a>. Several <a href="/wiki/Phonograph_record" title="Phonograph record">gramophone</a> compilations were recorded at the time by the three artists, which eventually led to the recognition of <a href="/wiki/Albanian_iso-polyphony" title="Albanian iso-polyphony">Albanian iso-polyphony</a> as a <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> <a href="/wiki/UNESCO_Intangible_Cultural_Heritage_Lists" title="UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists">Intangible Cultural Heritage</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-357" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-357">[354]</a></sup> </p>
      <p><a href="/wiki/Festivali_i_K%C3%ABng%C3%ABs" title="Festivali i Këngës">Festivali i Këngës</a> is a traditional Albanian song contest organised by the national broadcaster <a href="/wiki/Radio_Televizioni_Shqiptar" class="mw-redirect" title="Radio Televizioni Shqiptar">Radio Televizioni Shqiptar</a> (RTSH). The festival is celebrated annually since its inauguration in 1962 and has launched the careers of some of Albania's most successful singers including <a href="/wiki/Va%C3%A7e_Zela" title="Vaçe Zela">Vaçe Zela</a> and <a href="/wiki/Parashqevi_Simaku" title="Parashqevi Simaku">Parashqevi Simaku</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-358" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-358">[355]</a></sup> It is significantly a music competition among Albanian performers presenting unreleased songs in premiere, composed by Albanian authors and voted by juries or by public. </p>
      <p>Contemporary artists <a href="/wiki/Rita_Ora" title="Rita Ora">Rita Ora</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bebe_Rexha" title="Bebe Rexha">Bebe Rexha</a>, <a href="/wiki/Era_Istrefi" title="Era Istrefi">Era Istrefi</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dua_Lipa" title="Dua Lipa">Dua Lipa</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ava_Max" title="Ava Max">Ava Max</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bleona" title="Bleona">Bleona</a>, <a href="/wiki/Elvana_Gjata" title="Elvana Gjata">Elvana Gjata</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ermonela_Jaho" title="Ermonela Jaho">Ermonela Jaho</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Inva_Mula" title="Inva Mula">Inva Mula</a> have achieved international recognition for their music,<sup id="cite_ref-359" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-359">[356]</a></sup> while soprano <a href="/wiki/Ermonela_Jaho" title="Ermonela Jaho">Ermonela Jaho</a> has been described by some as the "world's most acclaimed soprano".<sup id="cite_ref-360" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-360">[357]</a></sup> Albanian opera singer <a href="/wiki/Saimir_Pirgu" title="Saimir Pirgu">Saimir Pirgu</a> was nominated for the 2017 <a href="/wiki/Grammy_Award" class="mw-redirect" title="Grammy Award">Grammy Award</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-361" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-361">[358]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Traditional_clothing">Traditional clothing</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Traditional_Albanian_clothing" class="mw-redirect" title="Traditional Albanian clothing">Traditional Albanian clothing</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_(c._1835).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg/220px-Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="137" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg/330px-Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg/440px-Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="771" data-file-height="481"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_(c._1835).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><i>The Albanian Dancer</i> (1835) by French artist <a href="/wiki/Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps" title="Alexandre-Gabriel Decamps">Alexandre-Gabriel Decamps</a>; the dancers are depicted wearing the <a href="/wiki/Fustanella" title="Fustanella">fustanella</a>, the <a href="/wiki/National_costume_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="National costume of Albania">national costume of Albania</a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Every cultural and geographical region of Albania has its own specific variety of costume that vary in style, material, color, shape, detail, and form.<sup id="cite_ref-362" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-362">[359]</a></sup> Presently, <a href="/wiki/National_costume_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="National costume of Albania">national costumes</a> are most often worn during special events and celebrations, mostly at ethnic festivals, religious holidays, weddings, and by performing dance groups. Some elderly people continue to wear traditional clothing in their daily lives. Clothing was traditionally made mainly from local materials such as leather, wool, linen, hemp fibre, and silk; Albanian textiles are still embroidered in elaborate ancient patterns. </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Literature">Literature</span></h3> 
      <table class="box-More_citations_needed_section plainlinks metadata ambox ambox-content ambox-Refimprove" role="presentation">

      </table>
