      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Meshari.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Meshari.jpg/220px-Meshari.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="149" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Meshari.jpg/330px-Meshari.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/23/Meshari.jpg 2x" data-file-width="400" data-file-height="271"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Meshari.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>An excerpt from the <a href="/wiki/Meshari" title="Meshari">Meshari</a> <i>(The Missal)</i> written by <a href="/wiki/Gjon_Buzuku" title="Gjon Buzuku">Gjon Buzuku</a>. <small>(1555)</small>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian language</a> comprises an independent branch and is a <a href="/wiki/Language_isolate" title="Language isolate">language isolate</a> within the <a href="/wiki/Indo-European_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Indo-European language">Indo-European</a> family of languages; it is not connected to any other known living language in Europe. Its origin is conclusively unknown, but it is believed to have descended from an ancient <a href="/wiki/Paleo-Balkan_languages" title="Paleo-Balkan languages">Paleo-Balkan language</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-363" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-363">[360]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-364" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-364">[361]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-365" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-365">[362]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The cultural renaissance was first of all expressed through the development of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian language</a> in the area of church texts and publications, mainly of the Catholic region in the northern of Albania, but also of the <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Orthodox_Church" title="Eastern Orthodox Church">Orthodox</a> in the south. The Protestant reforms invigorated hopes for the development of the local language and literary tradition, when cleric <a href="/wiki/Gjon_Buzuku" title="Gjon Buzuku">Gjon Buzuku</a> brought into the Albanian language the <a href="/wiki/Catholic_liturgy" title="Catholic liturgy">Catholic liturgy</a>, trying to do for the Albanian language, what <a href="/wiki/Martin_Luther" title="Martin Luther">Martin Luther</a> did for the German language. <a href="/wiki/Meshari" title="Meshari">Meshari</a> (<i>The Missal</i>) written by <a href="/wiki/Gjon_Buzuku" title="Gjon Buzuku">Gjon Buzuku</a> was published in 1555 and is considered as one of the first literary work of written Albanian during the Middle Ages. The refined level of the language and the stabilised orthography must be the result of an earlier tradition of written Albanian, a tradition that is not well understood. However, there is some fragmented evidence, pre-dating Buzuku, which indicates that Albanian was written from at least the 14th century. The earliest evidence dates from 1332&nbsp;AD with a Latin report from the French Dominican Guillelmus Adae, <a href="/wiki/Archbishop" title="Archbishop">Archbishop</a> of <a href="/wiki/Antivari" class="mw-redirect" title="Antivari">Antivari</a>, who wrote that Albanians used Latin letters in their books although their language was quite different from Latin. Other significant examples include: a <a href="/wiki/Formula_e_pag%C3%ABzimit" title="Formula e pagëzimit">baptism formula</a> (<i>Unte paghesont premenit Atit et Birit et spertit senit</i>) from 1462, written in Albanian within a Latin text by the Bishop of <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pal_Engj%C3%ABlli" title="Pal Engjëlli">Pal Engjëlli</a>; a glossary of Albanian words of 1497 by Arnold von Harff, a German who had travelled through Albania, and a 15th-century fragment of the Bible from the <a href="/wiki/Gospel_of_Matthew" title="Gospel of Matthew">Gospel of Matthew</a>, also in Albanian, but written in Greek letters. </p> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg/170px-Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="209" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg/255px-Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg/340px-Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg 2x" data-file-width="598" data-file-height="734"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Parashqevi-qirjazi_152_186.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Parashqevi_Qiriazi" title="Parashqevi Qiriazi">Parashqevi Qiriazi</a> - teacher and feminist (1880–1970)
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Albanian writings from these centuries must not have been religious texts only, but historical chronicles too. They are mentioned by the humanist <a href="/wiki/Marin_Barleti" title="Marin Barleti">Marin Barleti</a>, who in his book <a href="/wiki/Siege_of_Shkodra_(1478)#The_Book" class="mw-redirect" title="Siege of Shkodra (1478)">Siege of Shkodër</a> (<i>Rrethimi i Shkodrës</i>) from 1504, confirms that he leafed through such chronicles written in the language of the people (<i>in vernacula lingua</i>) as well as his famous biography of <a href="/wiki/Skanderbeg" title="Skanderbeg">Skanderbeg</a> <a href="/wiki/Marin_Barleti" title="Marin Barleti">Historia de vita et gestis Scanderbegi Epirotarum principis</a> (<i>History of Skanderbeg</i>) from 1508. The <i>History of Skanderbeg</i> is still the foundation of Skanderbeg studies and is considered an Albanian cultural treasure, vital to the formation of Albanian national self-consciousness. </p>
      <p>During the 16th and the 17th centuries, the <a href="/wiki/Catechism" title="Catechism">catechism</a> (<i>E mbësuame krishterë</i>) (Christian Teachings) from 1592 written by <a href="/wiki/Lek%C3%AB_Matr%C3%ABnga" class="mw-redirect" title="Lekë Matrënga">Lekë Matrënga</a>, (<i>Doktrina e krishterë</i>) (The Christian Doctrine) from 1618 and (<i>Rituale romanum</i>) 1621 by <a href="/wiki/Pjet%C3%ABr_Budi" title="Pjetër Budi">Pjetër Budi</a>, the first writer of original Albanian <a href="/wiki/Prose" title="Prose">prose</a> and poetry, an <a href="/wiki/Remorse" title="Remorse">apology</a> for George Castriot (1636) by <a href="/wiki/Frang_Bardhi" title="Frang Bardhi">Frang Bardhi</a>, who also published a dictionary and <a href="/wiki/Folklore" title="Folklore">folklore</a> creations, the theological-philosophical treaty <i><a href="/wiki/Cuneus_Prophetarum" title="Cuneus Prophetarum">Cuneus Prophetarum</a></i> (The Band of Prophets) (1685) by <a href="/wiki/Pjet%C3%ABr_Bogdani" title="Pjetër Bogdani">Pjetër Bogdani</a>, the most universal personality of Albanian <a href="/wiki/Middle_Ages" title="Middle Ages">Middle Ages</a>, were published in <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a>. The most famous Albanian writer in the 20th and 21st century is probably <a href="/wiki/Ismail_Kadare" title="Ismail Kadare">Ismail Kadare</a>. He has been mentioned as a possible recipient of the Nobel Prize in Literature several times. </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Sports">Sports</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       See also: <a href="/wiki/Albania_at_the_Olympics" title="Albania at the Olympics">Albania at the Olympics</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albania_at_the_Mediterranean_Games" title="Albania at the Mediterranean Games">Albania at the Mediterranean Games</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Lorik_cana_crop.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c3/Lorik_cana_crop.jpg/170px-Lorik_cana_crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="229" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c3/Lorik_cana_crop.jpg/255px-Lorik_cana_crop.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c3/Lorik_cana_crop.jpg/340px-Lorik_cana_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1297" data-file-height="1745"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Lorik_cana_crop.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Lorik_Cana" title="Lorik Cana">Lorik Cana</a> is Albania's most capped player of all time. He captained the French <a href="/wiki/Olympique_de_Marseille" title="Olympique de Marseille">Olympique de Marseille</a>, as well as the <a href="/wiki/Albania_national_football_team" title="Albania national football team">Albanian national team</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Albania participated at the <a href="/wiki/1972_Summer_Olympics" title="1972 Summer Olympics">Olympic Games in 1972</a> for the first time. The country made their Winter Olympic Games debut in <a href="/wiki/Winter_Olympics_2006" class="mw-redirect" title="Winter Olympics 2006">2006</a>. Albania missed the next four games, two of them due to the 1980 and 1984 boycotts, but returned for the 1992 games in <a href="/wiki/1992_Olympic_Winter_Games" class="mw-redirect" title="1992 Olympic Winter Games">Barcelona</a>. Since then, Albania have participated in all games. Albania normally competes in events that include swimming, athletics, weightlifting, shooting and wrestling. The country have been represented by the <a href="/wiki/National_Olympic_Committee_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="National Olympic Committee of Albania">National Olympic Committee of Albania</a> since 1972. The nation has participated at the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Games" title="Mediterranean Games">Mediterranean Games</a> since the games of <a href="/wiki/1987_Mediterranean_Games" title="1987 Mediterranean Games">1987</a> in Syria. The Albanian athletes have won a total of 43 (8 gold, 17 silver and 18 bronze) medals from <a href="/wiki/1987_Mediterranean_Games" title="1987 Mediterranean Games">1987</a> to <a href="/wiki/2013_Mediterranean_Games" title="2013 Mediterranean Games">2013</a>. </p> 
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Muzeu_Arkeologjike_Tirane.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Muzeu_Arkeologjike_Tirane.jpg/220px-Muzeu_Arkeologjike_Tirane.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Muzeu_Arkeologjike_Tirane.jpg/330px-Muzeu_Arkeologjike_Tirane.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Muzeu_Arkeologjike_Tirane.jpg/440px-Muzeu_Arkeologjike_Tirane.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1280" data-file-height="960"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Muzeu_Arkeologjike_Tirane.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Arena_Komb%C3%ABtare" title="Arena Kombëtare">Arena Kombëtare</a> in central Tirana
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Popular sports in Albania include <a href="/wiki/Football_in_Albania" title="Football in Albania">Football</a>, weightlifting, <a href="/wiki/Albania_national_basketball_team" class="mw-redirect" title="Albania national basketball team">basketball</a>, volleyball, tennis, swimming, <a href="/wiki/Rugby_union" title="Rugby union">rugby union</a> and gymnastics. Football is by far the most popular sport in Albania. It is governed by the <a href="/wiki/Football_Association_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Football Association of Albania">Football Association of Albania</a> (<a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a>: <i lang="sq">Federata Shqiptare e Futbollit</i>, F.SH.F.), which was created in 1930 and has membership in <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a> and <a href="/wiki/UEFA" title="UEFA">UEFA</a>. Football arrived in Albania early in the 20th century when the inhabitants of the northern city of <a href="/wiki/Shkod%C3%ABr" title="Shkodër">Shkodër</a> were surprised to see a strange game being played by students at a Christian mission. </p>
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Albania_national_football_team" title="Albania national football team">Albania national football team</a>, ranking 51st in the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Rankings" title="FIFA World Rankings">World</a> in 2017 (highest 22nd on 22 August 2015) have won the <a href="/wiki/1946_Balkan_Cup" title="1946 Balkan Cup">1946 Balkan Cup</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Rothmans_International_Tournament_2000" class="mw-redirect" title="Rothmans International Tournament 2000">Malta Rothmans International Tournament 2000</a>, but had never participated in any major <a href="/wiki/UEFA" title="UEFA">UEFA</a> or <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a> tournament, until <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016" title="UEFA Euro 2016">UEFA Euro 2016</a>, Albania's first ever appearance at the continental tournament and at a major men's football tournament. Albania scored their first ever goal in a major tournament and secured their first ever win in European Championship when they beat <a href="/wiki/Romania_national_football_team" title="Romania national football team">Romania</a> by 1–0 in a <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016" title="UEFA Euro 2016">UEFA Euro 2016</a> match on 19 June 2016.<sup id="cite_ref-366" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-366">[363]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-367" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-367">[364]</a></sup> The most successful football clubs in the country are <a href="/wiki/KF_Sk%C3%ABnderbeu_Kor%C3%A7%C3%AB" title="KF Skënderbeu Korçë">Skënderbeu</a>, <a href="/wiki/KF_Tirana" title="KF Tirana">KF Tirana</a>, <a href="/wiki/FK_Dinamo_Tirana" title="FK Dinamo Tirana">Dinamo Tirana</a>, <a href="/wiki/FK_Partizani_Tirana" title="FK Partizani Tirana">Partizani</a> and <a href="/wiki/KF_Vllaznia_Shkod%C3%ABr" title="KF Vllaznia Shkodër">Vllaznia</a>. </p>
      <p>Weightlifting is one of the most successful individual sport for the Albanians, with the national team winning medals at the <a href="/wiki/European_Weightlifting_Championships" title="European Weightlifting Championships">European Weightlifting Championships</a> and the rest international competitions. Albanian weightlifters have won a total of 16 medals at the <a href="/wiki/European_Weightlifting_Championships" title="European Weightlifting Championships">European Championships</a> with 1 of them being gold, 7 silver and 8 bronze. In the <a href="/wiki/World_Weightlifting_Championships" title="World Weightlifting Championships">World Weightlifting Championships</a>, the Albanian weightlifting team has won in <a href="/wiki/1972_World_Weightlifting_Championships" title="1972 World Weightlifting Championships">1972</a> a gold in <a href="/wiki/2002_World_Weightlifting_Championships" title="2002 World Weightlifting Championships">2002</a> a silver and in <a href="/wiki/2011_World_Weightlifting_Championships" title="2011 World Weightlifting Championships">2011</a> a bronze medal. </p> 
      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Diaspora">Diaspora</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_diaspora" title="Albanian diaspora">Albanian diaspora</a> and <a href="/wiki/Category:Albanian_diaspora" title="Category:Albanian diaspora">Albanian communities</a>
      </div> 
      <p>Historically, the Albanian people have established several communities in many regions throughout Southern Europe. The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_diaspora" title="Albanian diaspora">Albanian diaspora</a> has been formed since the late <a href="/wiki/Middle_Ages" title="Middle Ages">Middle Ages</a>, when they emigrated to places such as Italy, especially in <a href="/wiki/Sicily" title="Sicily">Sicily</a> and <a href="/wiki/Calabria" title="Calabria">Calabria</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">Greece</a> to escape either various socio-political difficulties or the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman conquest</a> of Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-368" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-368">[365]</a></sup> Following the <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">fall of communism</a>, large numbers of Albanians have migrated to countries such as Australia, Canada, France, Germany, <a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">Greece</a>, Italy, <a href="/wiki/Scandinavia" title="Scandinavia">Scandinavia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Switzerland" title="Switzerland">Switzerland</a>, United Kingdom and the United States. Albanian <a href="/wiki/Minority_group" title="Minority group">minorities</a> are present in the neighbouring territories such as the west of <a href="/wiki/North_Macedonia" title="North Macedonia">North Macedonia</a>, the east of <a href="/wiki/Montenegro" title="Montenegro">Montenegro</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a> in its entirety and southern <a href="/wiki/Serbia" title="Serbia">Serbia</a>. In <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a>, Albanians make up the largest ethnic group in the country. Altogether, the number of ethnic Albanian living abroad its territory is estimated to be higher than the total population inside the territory of Albania. </p> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span></h2> 
      <ul>
       <li><a href="/wiki/Outline_of_Albania" title="Outline of Albania">Outline of Albania</a></li> 
       <li><a href="/wiki/Index_of_Albania-related_articles" title="Index of Albania-related articles">Index of Albania-related articles</a></li> 
       <li><a href="/wiki/Bibliography_of_Albania" title="Bibliography of Albania">Bibliography of Albania</a></li>
      </ul>

      <div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha"> 
       <div class="mw-references-wrap">
        <ol class="references"> 
         <li id="cite_note-7"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-7">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><small>pronounced&nbsp;</small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Albanian" title="Help:IPA/Albanian">[ʃcipəˈɾi(a)]</a></span>; <a href="/wiki/Gheg_Albanian_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Gheg Albanian language">Gheg Albanian</a>: <i lang="aln">Shqipni</i> or <i lang="aln" title="Gheg Albanian-language text">Shqipnia</i>, also <i lang="aln" title="Gheg Albanian-language text">Shqypni</i> or <i lang="aln" title="Gheg Albanian-language text">Shqypnia</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">[6]</a></sup></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-8"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-8">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><small>Albanian pronunciation:&nbsp;</small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Albanian" title="Help:IPA/Albanian">[ɾɛpuˈblika ɛ ʃcipəˈɾisə]</a></span>.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-status-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-status_9-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-status_9-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Kosovo is the subject of a territorial dispute between the <a href="/wiki/Republic_of_Kosovo" class="mw-redirect" title="Republic of Kosovo">Republic of Kosovo</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Republic_of_Serbia" class="mw-redirect" title="Republic of Serbia">Republic of Serbia</a>. The Republic of Kosovo <a href="/wiki/2008_Kosovo_declaration_of_independence" title="2008 Kosovo declaration of independence">unilaterally declared independence</a> on 17 February 2008. <a href="/wiki/Kosovo%E2%80%93Serbia_relations" title="Kosovo–Serbia relations">Serbia continues to claim</a> it as part of its <a href="/wiki/Autonomous_Province_of_Kosovo_and_Metohija" title="Autonomous Province of Kosovo and Metohija">own sovereign territory</a>. The two governments <a href="/wiki/Belgrade%E2%80%93Pristina_negotiations" title="Belgrade–Pristina negotiations">began to normalise relations</a> in 2013, as part of the <a href="/wiki/2013_Brussels_Agreement" class="mw-redirect" title="2013 Brussels Agreement">2013 Brussels Agreement</a>. Kosovo is currently <i>(this note self-updates)</i> recognized as an independent state by <a href="/wiki/International_recognition_of_Kosovo" title="International recognition of Kosovo">98</a> out of the 193 <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_member_states" class="mw-redirect" title="United Nations member states">United Nations member states</a>. In total, <a href="/wiki/International_recognition_of_Kosovo" title="International recognition of Kosovo">113</a> UN member states recognized Kosovo at some point, of which <a href="/wiki/International_recognition_of_Kosovo" title="International recognition of Kosovo">15</a> later withdrew their recognition.</span> </li> 
        </ol>
       </div>
      </div>

           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFLloshi1999" class="citation book cs1">Lloshi, Xhevat (1999). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Phyvk2tPaYQC">"Albanian"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-25"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-25">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Kristo Frasheri. <i>History of Albania (A Brief Overview)</i>. Tirana, 1964.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-26"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-26">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFLloshi" class="citation web cs1">Lloshi, Xhevat. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110709114947/http://mirror.undp.org/albania/download/pdf/albanian.pdf">"The Albanian Language"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>.          <li id="cite_note-Prendi-27"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Prendi_27-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Prendi_27-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">F.          <li id="cite_note-28"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-28">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFBritish_Association_for_Mycenaean_Studies1973" class="citation book cs1">British Association for Mycenaean Studies (1973). Crossland, R. A.; Birchall, Ann (eds.). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=MUkbAAAAYAAJ"><i>Bronze Age Migrations in the Aegean; Archaeological and Linguistic Problems in Greek Prehistory: Proceedings of the First International Colloquium on Aegean Prehistory, Sheffield</i></a>. <b>4</b>. <a href="/wiki/Duckworth_Books" title="Duckworth Books">Duckworth Books</a>. pp.&nbsp;189–198. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-7156-0580-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-7156-0580-6"><bdi>978-0-7156-0580-6</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">16 March</span> 2011</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Bronze+Age+Migrations+in+the+Aegean%3B+Archaeological+and+Linguistic+Problems+in+Greek+Prehistory%3A+Proceedings+of+the+First+International+Colloquium+on+Aegean+Prehistory%2C+Sheffield&amp;rft.pages=189-198&amp;rft.pub=Duckworth+Books&amp;rft.date=1973&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-7156-0580-6&amp;rft.au=British+Association+for+Mycenaean+Studies&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DMUkbAAAAYAAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-29"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-29">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Nicholas Geoffrey Lemprière Hammond, Guy Thompson Griffith <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=PnEJAQAAIAAJ&amp;q=%22+The+centre+which+repeatedly+gave+off+this+style+of+design+seems+to+have+been+Albania.+As+we+have+concluded+on+other+grounds+that+this+area+was+a+reservoir+of+Greek-+speaking+%22">A History of Macedonia: Historical geography and prehistory</a>. Clarendon Press, 1972, p. 290</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-Hammond1993-30"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Hammond1993_30-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Nicholas Geoffrey Lemprière Hammond. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=eW0iAQAAIAAJ&amp;q=%22The+leading+dans+of+both+groups+buried+their+dead+under+a+circular+tumulus+of+soil+in+the+second+millennium+BC+The+main+reservoir+of+the+Greek+speakers+was+central+Albania+and+Epirus%2C+and+it+was+from+there+that+the+founders+of+Mycenaean+civilization+came+to+Mycenae%2C+c.+1600+BC%2C+and+burried+their+nobles+in+Grave+Circle+B.+Further+waves+of+immigrants+passing+through+and+from+Epirus+people+the+Greek+peninsula+and+islands+the+last+wave%2C+called+Dorians%2C+settling+from+1100+onwards.+The+lands+they+left+in+central+Albania+were+occupied+during+the+so-called+Dark+Age+%28U10-800BC%29+by+Illyrians%2C+whose+main+habitat+was+in+the+area+now+called+Bosnia%2C%22">Studies: Further studies on various topics</a>. A.M. Hakkert, 1993, p. 231: "The leading dans of both groups buried their dead under a circular tumulus of soil in the second millennium BC The main reservoir of the Greek speakers was central Albania and Epirus, and it was from there that the founders of Mycenaean civilization came to Mycenae, c. 1600 BC, and buried their nobles in Grave Circle B. Further waves of immigrants passing through and from Epirus people the Greek peninsula and islands the last wave, called Dorians, settling from 1100 onwards. The lands they left in central Albania were occupied during the so-called Dark Age (U10-800BC) by Illyrians, whose main habitat was in the area now called Bosnia,"</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-31"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-31">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFRoismanWorthington2010" class="citation cs2">Roisman, Joseph; Worthington, Ian (2010), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=lkYFVJ3U-BIC"><i>A Companion to Ancient Macedonia</i></a>, John Wiley and Sons, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4051-7936-2" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4051-7936-2"><bdi>978-1-4051-7936-2</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=A+Companion+to+Ancient+Macedonia&amp;rft.pub=John+Wiley+and+Sons&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4051-7936-2&amp;rft.aulast=Roisman&amp;rft.aufirst=Joseph&amp;rft.au=Worthington%2C+Ian&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DlkYFVJ3U-BIC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-Boardman629-32"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Boardman629_32-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">John Boardman. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=vXljf8JqmkoC&amp;pg=PA629">The prehistory of the Balkans and the Middle East and the Aegean world</a>. Cambridge University Press, 1982. 
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-521-22496-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-521-22496-3">978-0-521-22496-3</a>, p. 629: "...<span class="nowrap">&nbsp;</span>the southernmost outliers of the tribes which held the Zeta valley, as such they may have been the immediate neighbours of Greek-speaking tribes in the Bronze Age."</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-33"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-33">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Wilkes John. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=4Nv6SPRKqs8C&amp;q=%22astride%20the%20modern%20frontier%20between%20Albania%20and%20Yugoslav%20Montenegro%22">The Illyrians</a>.          <li id="cite_note-34"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-34">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Illyrians (The Peoples of Europe) by John Wilkes, 1996, 
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-631-19807-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-631-19807-9">978-0-631-19807-9</a>, page 92, "Appian's description of the Illyrian territories records a southern boundary with Chaonia and Thesprotia, where ancient Epirus began south of river Aoous (Vjose)" <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=4Nv6SPRKqs8C&amp;lpg=PP1&amp;pg=PR20">also map</a></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-42"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-42">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFJackson-Laufer1999" class="citation book cs1">Jackson-Laufer, Guida Myrl (1 January 1999). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/isbn_9791576070917"><i>Women Rulers Throughout the Ages: An Illustrated Guide</i></a></span>.          <li id="cite_note-58"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-58">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-59"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-59">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFLicursi2011" class="citation journal cs1">Licursi, Emiddio Pietro (2011). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.scribd.com/doc/72122169/7/Pashko-Vasa">"Empire of Nations: The Consolidation of Albanian and Turkish National Identities in the Late Ottoman Empire, 1878–1913"</a>. New York: Columbia University: 19. <a href="/wiki/Hdl_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Hdl (identifier)">hdl</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//hdl.handle.net/10022%2FAC%3AP%3A10297">10022/AC:P:10297</a>. <q>By 1415, after a chaotic interregnum, Sultan Mehmet I sent the military to erect the first Ottoman garrisons throughout southern Albania, establishing direct military authority in the region&nbsp;... l jurisdiction over most of Albania&nbsp;...</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=Empire+of+Nations%3A+The+Consolidation+of+Albanian+and+Turkish+National+Identities+in+the+Late+Ottoman+Empire%2C+1878%E2%80%931913&amp;rft.pages=19&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft_id=info%3Ahdl%2F10022%2FAC%3AP%3A10297&amp;rft.aulast=Licursi&amp;rft.aufirst=Emiddio+Pietro&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.scribd.com%2Fdoc%2F72122169%2F7%2FPashko-Vasa&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span> <span class="cs1-hidden-error error citation-comment">Cite journal requires <code class="cs1-code">|journal=</code> (<a href="/wiki/Help:CS1_errors#missing_periodical" title="Help:CS1 errors">help</a>)</span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-Hupchich110-60"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Hupchich110_60-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=sQGIDAAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA120&amp;lpg=PA120&amp;dq=albania+vassal+serbia&amp;hl=pt-PT#v=onepage&amp;q=albania%20vassal%20serbia">The Balkans: From Constantinople to Communism</a> by D.          <li id="cite_note-72"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-72">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFKopecekErsoyGorniKechriotis2006" class="citation cs2">Kopecek, Michal; Ersoy, Ahmed; Gorni, Maciej; Kechriotis, Vangelis; Manchev, Boyan; Trencsenyi, Balazs; Turda, Marius (2006), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=k5Vsjg508EYC&amp;pg=PA349"><i>Discourses of collective identity in Central and Southeast Europe (1770–1945)</i></a>, <b>1</b>, Budapest, Hungary: Central European University Press, p.&nbsp;348, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-963-7326-52-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-963-7326-52-3"><bdi>978-963-7326-52-3</bdi></a>, <q>The position of the League in the beginning was based on religious solidarity. It was even called <i>Komiteti i Myslimanëve të Vërtetë</i> (The Committee of the Real Muslims)&nbsp;... decisions are taken and supported mostly by landlords and people closely connected with Ottoman administration and religious authorities..</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Discourses+of+collective+identity+in+Central+and+Southeast+Europe+%281770%E2%80%931945%29&amp;rft.place=Budapest%2C+Hungary&amp;rft.pages=348&amp;rft.pub=Central+European+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft.isbn=978-963-7326-52-3&amp;rft.aulast=Kopecek&amp;rft.aufirst=Michal&amp;rft.au=Ersoy%2C+Ahmed&amp;rft.au=Gorni%2C+Maciej&amp;rft.au=Kechriotis%2C+Vangelis&amp;rft.au=Manchev%2C+Boyan&amp;rft.au=Trencsenyi%2C+Balazs&amp;rft.au=Turda%2C+Marius&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Dk5Vsjg508EYC%26pg%3DPA349&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-73"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-73">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFKopečekErsoyGorniKechriotis2006" class="citation cs2">Kopeček, Michal; Ersoy, Ahmed; Gorni, Maciej; Kechriotis, Vangelis; Manchev, Boyan; Trencsenyi, Balazs; Turda, Marius (2006), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=k5Vsjg508EYC&amp;pg=PA349">"Program of the Albanian League of Prizren"</a>, <i>Discourses of collective identity in Central and Southeast Europe (1770–1945)</i>, <b>1</b>, Budapest, Hungary: Central European University Press, p.&nbsp;347, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-963-7326-52-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-963-7326-52-3"><bdi>978-963-7326-52-3</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">18 January</span> 2011</span>, <q>there were no delegates from Shkodra villayet and a few Bosnian delegates also participated. Present was also mutasarrif (administrator of sandjak) of Prizren as representative of the central authorities</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Program+of+the+Albanian+League+of+Prizren&amp;rft.btitle=Discourses+of+collective+identity+in+Central+and+Southeast+Europe+%281770%E2%80%931945%29&amp;rft.place=Budapest%2C+Hungary&amp;rft.pages=347&amp;rft.pub=Central+European+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft.isbn=978-963-7326-52-3&amp;rft.aulast=Kope%C4%8Dek&amp;rft.aufirst=Michal&amp;rft.au=Ersoy%2C+Ahmed&amp;rft.au=Gorni%2C+Maciej&amp;rft.au=Kechriotis%2C+Vangelis&amp;rft.au=Manchev%2C+Boyan&amp;rft.au=Trencsenyi%2C+Balazs&amp;rft.au=Turda%2C+Marius&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Dk5Vsjg508EYC%26pg%3DPA349&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-albanianhistory.net-74"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-albanianhistory.net_74-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFElsie" class="citation web cs1"><a href="/wiki/Robert_Elsie" title="Robert Elsie">Elsie, Robert</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20100908114200/http://www.albanianhistory.net/texts19/AH1878_2.html">"1878 The Resolutions of the League of Prizren"</a>. albanianhistory.net. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.albanianhistory.net/texts19/AH1878_2.html">the original</a> on 8 September 2010<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">20 February</span> 2011</span>. <q>On 10 June 1878,&nbsp;... The League of Prizren, Alb. Lidhja e Prizrenit,&nbsp;... On 13 June 1878, the League submitted an eighteen-page memorandum to Benjamin Disraeli, the British representative at the Congress of Berlin</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=1878+The+Resolutions+of+the+League+of+Prizren&amp;rft.pub=albanianhistory.net&amp;rft.aulast=Elsie&amp;rft.aufirst=Robert&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.albanianhistory.net%2Ftexts19%2FAH1878_2.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-League_of_Prizren-75"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-League_of_Prizren_75-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation encyclopaedia cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/12553/Albanian-League">"Albanian League"</a>. <i>Encyclopædia Britannica</i><span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-84"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-84">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFElsie" class="citation web cs1"><a href="/wiki/Robert_Elsie" title="Robert Elsie">Elsie, Robert</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110717003848/http://www.albanianphotography.net/en/dmm.html">"Albania under prince Wied"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-85"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-85">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFJelavich1999" class="citation cs2">Jelavich, Barbara (1999) [1983], <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Hd-or3qtqrsC&amp;pg=PA100"><i>History of the Balkans: Twentieth century</i></a>, <b>2</b>, Cambridge, United Kingdom: The Press Syndicate of University of Cambridge, p.&nbsp;103, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-521-27459-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-521-27459-3"><bdi>978-0-521-27459-3</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">25 January</span> 2011</span>, <q>peasants..willing listeners to Ottoman propaganda&nbsp;... attached the new regime as a tool of the beys and Christian powers</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=History+of+the+Balkans%3A+Twentieth+century&amp;rft.place=Cambridge%2C+United+Kingdom&amp;rft.pages=103&amp;rft.pub=The+Press+Syndicate+of+University+of+Cambridge&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-521-27459-3&amp;rft.aulast=Jelavich&amp;rft.aufirst=Barbara&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DHd-or3qtqrsC%26pg%3DPA100&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-86"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-86">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFBowden2003" class="citation book cs1">Bowden, William (2003). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=IjsbAAAAYAAJ&amp;q=%22+Autonomous+Republic+of+Northern+Epirus.%22"><i>Epirus Vetus&nbsp;: the archaeology of a late antique province</i></a>.          <li id="cite_note-87"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-87">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFed1994" class="citation book cs1">ed, Gregory C. Ference (1994). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=RSLsAAAAMAAJ"><i>Chronology of 20th century eastern European history</i></a>. Detroit [u.a.]: Gale Research. p.&nbsp;9. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8103-8879-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8103-8879-6"><bdi>978-0-8103-8879-6</bdi></a>. <q>February 28 George Zographos, a former foreign minister of Greece, proclaims at Gjirokaster the establishment of the Autonomous Republic of Northern Epirus, with Zographos as president. He notifies the International Commission that his government has been established because the Great Powers have not provided the Greeks in southern Albania any guarantees for the protection of the life, property and religious freedom, and ethnic existence.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Chronology+of+20th+century+eastern+European+history&amp;rft.place=Detroit+%5Bu.a.%5D&amp;rft.pages=9&amp;rft.pub=Gale+Research&amp;rft.date=1994&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8103-8879-6&amp;rft.aulast=ed&amp;rft.aufirst=Gregory+C.+Ference&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DRSLsAAAAMAAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-88"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-88">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110601023209/http://albaniainbrief.com/Albanian%20History/Fighting%20for%20amputated%20Albania.htm">"The Efforts to settle amputated Albania state"</a>. albaniainbrief.com. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">28 January</span> 2011</span>. <q>Thousands of muslim peasants,&nbsp;... were exploited by their leaders Haxhi Qamili, Arif Hiqmeti, Musa Qazimi and Mustafa Ndroqi,&nbsp;... to rebel</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Efforts+to+settle+amputated+Albania+state&amp;rft.pub=albaniainbrief.com&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.albaniainbrief.com%2FAlbanian%2520History%2FFighting%2520for%2520amputated%2520Albania.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-89"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-89">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-105"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-105">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFPano" class="citation web cs1">Pano, Aristotel. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.revolutionarydemocracy.org/archive/panorama.htm">"Panorama of the Economic-Social Development of Socialist Albania"</a><span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-108"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-108">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Kombësia dhe feja në Shqipëri, 1920–1944 / Roberto Morocco dela Roka; e përktheu nga origjinali Luan Omari.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-Elsie_p27-109"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Elsie_p27_109-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Elsie_p27_109-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-114"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-114">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">For the most part, the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_diaspora" title="Albanian diaspora">Albanian refugees</a> emigrated to <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_Italy" title="Albanians in Italy">Italy</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albanian_communities_in_Greece" title="Albanian communities in Greece">Greece</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_Switzerland" title="Albanians in Switzerland">Switzerland</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_Germany" title="Albanians in Germany">Germany</a>, or North America.</span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-123"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-123">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-134"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-134">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFBolevich2017" class="citation web cs1">Bolevich, Maria (3 January 2017). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.newscientist.com/article/2116873-largest-lake-in-southern-europe-under-threat-from-eco-resort/">"Largest lake in southern Europe under threat from "eco-resort<span class="cs1-kern-right">"</span>"</a>. <i>New Scientist</i>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=New+Scientist&amp;rft.atitle=Largest+lake+in+southern+Europe+under+threat+from+%22eco-resort%22&amp;rft.date=2017-01-03&amp;rft.aulast=Bolevich&amp;rft.aufirst=Maria&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newscientist.com%2Farticle%2F2116873-largest-lake-in-southern-europe-under-threat-from-eco-resort%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-135"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-135">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://whc.unesco.org/en/list/99">"Natural and Cultural Heritage of the Ohrid region"</a>. UNESCO. pp.&nbsp;UNESCO. <q>Situated on the shores of Lake Ohrid, the town of Ohrid is one of the oldest human settlements in Europe; Lake Ohrid is a superlative natural phenomenon, providing refuge for numerous endemic and relict freshwater species of flora and fauna dating from the tertiary period. As a deep and ancient lake of tectonic origin, Lake Ohrid has existed continuously for approximately two to three million years.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Natural+and+Cultural+Heritage+of+the+Ohrid+region&amp;rft.pages=UNESCO&amp;rft.pub=UNESCO&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwhc.unesco.org%2Fen%2Flist%2F99&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-136"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-136">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.today/20080914032610/http://www.investinmacedonia.com/page.aspx?language=&amp;page=O25QDpgVFLj9Bfg/vkoGyw==">"Lake Ohrid; Invest in Macedonia – Agency for Foreign Investments of the Republic of Macedonia"</a>. <i>InvestInMacedonia.com</i>. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.investinmacedonia.com/page.aspx?language=&amp;page=O25QDpgVFLj9Bfg/vkoGyw==">the original</a> on 14 September 2008<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">3 June</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=InvestInMacedonia.com&amp;rft.atitle=Lake+Ohrid%3B+Invest+in+Macedonia+%E2%80%93+Agency+for+Foreign+Investments+of+the+Republic+of+Macedonia&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.investinmacedonia.com%2Fpage.aspx%3Flanguage%3D%26page%3DO25QDpgVFLj9Bfg%2FvkoGyw%3D%3D&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-climate-137"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-climate_137-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFNaturAL" class="citation web cs1">NaturAL. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170311223347/http://www.natura.al/page.php?lang=en&amp;section=albaniatowardsn2000">"Albania towards NATURA 2000"</a>. <i>natura.al</i>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">26 November</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=natura.al&amp;rft.atitle=Albania+towards+NATURA+2000&amp;rft.pages=1&amp;rft.au=NaturAL&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.natura.al%2Fpage.php%3Flang%3Den%26section%3Dalbaniatowardsn2000&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-152"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-152">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.worldatlas.com/articles/the-national-parks-of-albania-protecting-the-natural-treasures-of-the-country.html">"The National Parks of Albania The fifteen national parks in Albania encompass an area of 210,668.48 hectares which accounts for about 3.65% of the overall territory of the country"</a>. <i>worldatlas.com</i>. <q>The territory of Albania can be divided into four ecoregions: Dinaric Alpine (mixed forests in the far north). Balcanic (mixed forest in the north-east). Pindus mountain (mixed forests covering the central and southeast mountains). Illyrian deciduous (forest covering the rest of the country).</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=worldatlas.com&amp;rft.atitle=The+National+Parks+of+Albania+The+fifteen+national+parks+in+Albania+encompass+an+area+of+210%2C668.48+hectares+which+accounts+for+about+3.65%25+of+the+overall+territory+of+the+country.&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.worldatlas.com%2Farticles%2Fthe-national-parks-of-albania-protecting-the-natural-treasures-of-the-country.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-153"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-153">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-terref-182"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-terref_182-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150524170836/http://www.reformaterritoriale.al/en/roadmap/history">"A Brief History of the Administrative-territorial Organization in Albania"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-237"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-237">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/rankorder/2102rank.html?countryName=Albania&amp;countryCode=al&amp;regionCode=eu&amp;rank=51#al">"Life Expectancy at Birth"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-diversify-254"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-diversify_254-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.allbusiness.com/energy-utilities/utilities-industry-electric-power/11935171-1.html">Enel Albanian Joint Venture Introduces Coal In Albania's Power Mix</a>, Business Monitor Online, 24 February 2009 <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120219093411/http://www.allbusiness.com/energy-utilities/utilities-industry-electric-power/11935171-1.html">Archived</a> 19 February 2012 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-EUDO-287"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-EUDO_287-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-EUDO_287-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130224021716/http://eudo-citizenship.eu/news/citizenship-news/582-the-politics-of-numbers-and-identity-in-albania">"The politics of numbers and identity in Albania"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-Shkurtaj2017-299"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Shkurtaj2017_299-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFGjovalin_Shkurtaj2017" class="citation book cs1">Gjovalin Shkurtaj (2017). <i>Urgjenca gjuhësore: -huazime të zëvendësueshme me fjalë shqipe-&nbsp;: (fjalorth)</i>. Naimi. pp.&nbsp;15–16. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9789928234049" title="Special:BookSources/9789928234049"><bdi>9789928234049</bdi></a>. <q>Sic u permend me lart, per shkak te shkaqeve kulturore dhe ekonomike, trendet e mesimit te gjuheve nga te rinjte (grupmosha deri ne 25 vjec) ndryshojne. Keto trende jane percaktues i nje sere fenomeneve shoqerore, sic do te shohim me tej. Keshtu nga viti 2000 e ketej, gjuha angleze, gjermane dhe ajo turke kane pasur nje rritje te interest. Gjuha italiane, por edhe ajo franceze kane pasur nje stabilitet, pra as rritje dhe as ulje te interesit te pergjithshem nga ana e grupmoshes te siperpermendur. Vihet re se gjuha greke ka pesuar nje renie te forte te interesit. Ne fakt, shumica e interesit ka rene per kete gjuhe. Arsyet per kete gjuhe specifike do ti trajtojme me tej ne kapitulin e trete.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Urgjenca+gjuh%C3%ABsore%3A+-huazime+t%C3%AB+z%C3%ABvend%C3%ABsueshme+me+fjal%C3%AB+shqipe-+%3A+%28fjalorth%29&amp;rft.pages=15-16&amp;rft.pub=Naimi&amp;rft.date=2017&amp;rft.isbn=9789928234049&amp;rft.au=Gjovalin+Shkurtaj&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.kathimerini.gr/138922/article/epikairothta/politikh/h-ellhnikh-glwssa-ginetai-ka8omiloymenh-sthn-alvania">"The Greek language is widely spoken in Albania (H Ελληνική γλώσσα γίνεται καθομιλουμένη στην Αλβανία)"</a>. <i>Kathimerini</i><span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-303"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-303">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFBugajski1995" class="citation book cs1">Bugajski, Janusz (1995). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/ethnicpoliticsin0000buga"><i>Ethnic politics in Eastern Europe&nbsp;: a guide to nationality policies, organisations, and parties</i></a></span> (With a new postscript.&nbsp;ed.). Armonk, N.Y.: M.E. Sharpe. p.&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/ethnicpoliticsin0000buga/page/268">268</a>. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9781563242823" title="Special:BookSources/9781563242823"><bdi>9781563242823</bdi></a>. <q>The stalinist regime of Enver Hoxha imposed a ruthless dictatorship in the country the lasted with little respite<span class="nowrap">&nbsp;</span>...</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Ethnic+politics+in+Eastern+Europe+%3A+a+guide+to+nationality+policies%2C+organisations%2C+and+parties&amp;rft.place=Armonk%2C+N.Y.&amp;rft.pages=268&amp;rft.edition=With+a+new+postscript.&amp;rft.pub=M.E.+Sharpe&amp;rft.date=1995&amp;rft.isbn=9781563242823&amp;rft.aulast=Bugajski&amp;rft.aufirst=Janusz&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fethnicpoliticsin0000buga&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFJazexhi2013" class="citation book cs1">Jazexhi, Olsi (2013). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=ia5AAQAAQBAJ&amp;q=albania&amp;pg=PA351">"Albania"</a>. They have also claimed that many members of the Muslim Community were not counted in the census."</span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-Flamuri-335"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Flamuri_335-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Flamuri_335-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160804012641/http://www.qbz.gov.al/botime/fletore_zyrtare/2002/PDF-2002/48-2002.pdf">"Për formën dhe përmasat e Flamurit kombëtar përmbajtjen e Himnit kombëtar, formën dhe përmasat e Stemës së Republikës të Shqiperisë dhe mënyrën e përdorimit të tyre"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> (in Albanian). Tirana: <a href="/w/index.php?title=Fletorja_zyrtare_e_Republik%C3%ABs_s%C3%AB_Shqip%C3%ABris%C3%AB&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Fletorja zyrtare e Republikës së Shqipërisë (page does not exist)">Fletorja zyrtare e Republikës së Shqipërisë</a>. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.qbz.gov.al/botime/fletore_zyrtare/2002/PDF-2002/48-2002.pdf">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 4 August 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">.            <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-884964-98-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-884964-98-5">978-1-884964-98-5</a>,

           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-08-087774-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-08-087774-7">978-0-08-087774-7</a>, 
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-08-087774-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-08-087774-7">978-0-08-087774-7</a> (<i>"Albanian constitutes a single branch of the Indo-European family of languages. It is often held to be related to Illyrian, a poorly attested language spoken in the Western Balkans in classical times"</i> page 22)</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-365"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-365">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20080203035926/http://linguistlist.org/forms/langs/LLDescription.cfm?code=txh">"The Thracian language"</a>. The Linguist List. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://linguistlist.org/forms/langs/LLDescription.cfm?code=txh">the original</a> on 3 February 2008<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">27 January</span> 2008</span>. <q>An ancient language of Southern Balkans, belonging to the Satem group of Indo-European. This language is the most likely ancestor of modern Albanian (which is also a Satem language), though the evidence is scanty. 1st Millennium BC&nbsp;– 500&nbsp;AD.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Thracian+language&amp;rft.pub=The+Linguist+List&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Flinguistlist.org%2Fforms%2Flangs%2FLLDescription.cfm%3Fcode%3Dtxh&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

      </div> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Further_reading">Further reading</span></h2> 
      <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011217839">.mw-parser-output .refbegin{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul{margin-left:0}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul>li{margin-left:0;padding-left:3.2em;text-indent:-3.2em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents ul,.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents ul li{list-style:none}@media(max-width:720px){.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul>li{padding-left:1.6em;text-indent:-1.6em}}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-100{font-size:100%}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns ul{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}</style>
      <div class="refbegin" style=""> 
       <ul>
        <li><i>History of the Party of Labor of Albania</i>. Tirana: Institute of Marxist–Leninist Studies, 1971. 691 p.</li> 
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFAbrahams2015" class="citation book cs1">Abrahams, Fred (2015). <i>Modern Albania: From Dictatorship to Democracy in Europe</i>. NYU Press. p.&nbsp;384. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8147-0511-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8147-0511-7"><bdi>978-0-8147-0511-7</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Modern+Albania%3A+From+Dictatorship+to+Democracy+in+Europe&amp;rft.pages=384&amp;rft.pub=NYU+Press&amp;rft.date=2015&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8147-0511-7&amp;rft.aulast=Abrahams&amp;rft.aufirst=Fred&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span></li>

               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Geographically fully located</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px;background:#f6f6f6;">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                  <ul>
                   <li><a class="mw-selflink selflink">Albania</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Bosnia_and_Herzegovina" title="Bosnia and Herzegovina">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Bulgaria" title="Bulgaria">Bulgaria</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a><sup><small>1</small></sup></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Montenegro" title="Montenegro">Montenegro</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/North_Macedonia" title="North Macedonia">North Macedonia</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
                <td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="4" style="width:1px;padding:0px 0px 0px 2px">
                 <div>
                  <a href="/wiki/File:Balkan_topo_en.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Balkan topo en.jpg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b6/Balkan_topo_en.jpg/100px-Balkan_topo_en.jpg" decoding="async" width="100" height="91" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b6/Balkan_topo_en.jpg/150px-Balkan_topo_en.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b6/Balkan_topo_en.jpg/200px-Balkan_topo_en.jpg 2x" data-file-width="840" data-file-height="767"></a>
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Significantly located</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px;background:transparent;">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                  <ul>
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Serbia" title="Serbia">Serbia</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">Greece</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Croatia" title="Croatia">Croatia</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Mostly outside of the peninsula</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px;background:#f6f6f6;">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                  <ul>
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Slovenia" title="Slovenia">Slovenia</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Turkey" title="Turkey">Turkey</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">See also</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px;background:transparent;">

                   <li><a href="/wiki/Languages_of_the_Balkans" title="Languages of the Balkans">Balkan languages</a> <small>(<a href="/wiki/Balkan_sprachbund" title="Balkan sprachbund">Sprachbund</a>)</small></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Balkanization" title="Balkanization">Balkanization</a></li>

                <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3">
                 <div>
                  <sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/2008_Kosovo_declaration_of_independence" title="2008 Kosovo declaration of independence">Declared independence</a> from Serbia on 17 February 2008 and is <a href="/wiki/International_recognition_of_Kosovo" title="International recognition of Kosovo">recognised by&nbsp;113</a> <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_Nations_member_states" class="mw-redirect" title="List of United Nations member states">United Nations member states</a>, while 10 states have recognized Kosovo only to later withdraw their recognition..
                 </div></td>

               <tr>
                <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3" style="text-align:left;">
                 <div>
                  <div class="plainlist">
                   <ul>
                    <li><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li>
                    <li><sup>2</sup> Some countries completely outside the conventional geographical boundaries of Europe are commonly associated with the continent due to ethnological links.</li>
                   </ul>
                  </div>

                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%;background-color:#DCDCDC;"><a href="/wiki/Structure_of_NATO" title="Structure of NATO">Structure</a></th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">

                   <li><a href="/wiki/North_Atlantic_Council" title="North Atlantic Council">Council</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Supreme_Headquarters_Allied_Powers_Europe" title="Supreme Headquarters Allied Powers Europe">Supreme Headquarters Allied Powers Europe</a> 
                    <ul>
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Allied_Air_Command" title="Allied Air Command">Air Command</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Allied_Land_Command" title="Allied Land Command">Land Command</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Allied_Maritime_Command" title="Allied Maritime Command">Maritime Command</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Allied_Joint_Force_Command_Brunssum" title="Allied Joint Force Command Brunssum">JFC Brunssum</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Allied_Joint_Force_Command_Naples" title="Allied Joint Force Command Naples">JFC Naples</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Naval_Striking_and_Support_Forces_NATO" title="Naval Striking and Support Forces NATO">STRIKFORNATO</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Joint_Force_Command_Norfolk" title="Joint Force Command Norfolk">JFCNF</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Joint_Support_and_Enabling_Command" title="Joint Support and Enabling Command">Joint Support and Enabling Command</a></li>
                    </ul></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Allied_Command_Transformation" title="Allied Command Transformation">Allied Command Transformation</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/NATO_Parliamentary_Assembly" title="NATO Parliamentary Assembly">Parliamentary Assembly</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Standardization_Agreement" title="Standardization Agreement">Standardization Agreement</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%;background-color:#DCDCDC;">People</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                  <ul>

                 </div></td>
               </tr>

                       <li><span class="nowrap"><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Flag_of_Palestine.svg/23px-Flag_of_Palestine.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Flag_of_Palestine.svg/35px-Flag_of_Palestine.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Flag_of_Palestine.svg/46px-Flag_of_Palestine.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="600">&nbsp;</span><a href="/wiki/State_of_Palestine" title="State of Palestine">Palestine</a></span>

                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Member_states_of_the_Organisation_internationale_de_la_Francophonie" title="Member states of the Organisation internationale de la Francophonie">Members</a></th>

                 <table class="nowraplinks navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0">
                  <tbody>
                   <tr>
                    <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%;font-weight:normal;">Members</th>
                    <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                     <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                      <ul>
                       <li><a class="mw-selflink selflink">Albania</a></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Andorra" title="Andorra">Andorra</a></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Armenia" title="Armenia">Armenia</a></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Belgium" title="Belgium">Belgium</a></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Benin" title="Benin">Benin</a></li>

          <th id="Authority_control_frameless_&amp;#124;text-top_&amp;#124;10px_&amp;#124;alt=Edit_this_at_Wikidata_&amp;#124;link=https&amp;#58;//www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q222#identifiers&amp;#124;Edit_this_at_Wikidata" scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Help:Authority_control" title="Help:Authority control">Authority control</a> <a href="https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q222#identifiers" title="Edit this at Wikidata"><img alt="Edit this at Wikidata" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/8a/OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg/10px-OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg.png" decoding="async" width="10" height="10" style="vertical-align: text-top" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/8a/OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg/15px-OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/8a/OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="20" data-file-height="20"></a></th>

      <h3> <label for="searchInput">Search</label> </h3> 
      <form action="/w/index.php" id="searchform"> 
       <div id="simpleSearch" data-search-loc="header-navigation">
